Title: Senior Insights Analyst
Description:
What We Do

Roo (www.roo.vet) has created the first B2B labor marketplace in animal healthcare that connects veterinary professionals with hospitals through innovative technology, with opportunities to expand and offer more opportunities for both our demand & supply of users.

Our dynamic platform enables hospitals to fulfill personnel needs in real time, while allowing high-quality veterinary professionals to secure work at the click of a button. Beyond the platform, Roo represents a growing opportunity to help hospitals meet all-things staffing, and a growing community of resilient vet industry professionals who value flexibility and work-life balance, in addition to providing the best possible outcomes for clients and their pets.

Our aim is to combine experienced healthcare expertise with Silicon Valley talent to shake up this industry and change the way veterinarians and hospitals work!

About the role

At Roo, the Growth team works alongside the Director of Growth to define the objectives of our company initiatives and ensure we are able to measure their impact.

The team has 4 major goals:

Prototyping new data-driven workflows designed to unlock growth.

Helping teams/initiatives/projects define and dashboard their North Star.

Helping teams/initiatives/projects run trusted experiments that attempt to improve a Roo Equation metric.

Helping teams identify interesting trends and perform deep dive analysis

We are extremely data driven and focus on a first principles approach. The team is involved in the full lifecycle of major product initiatives: leveraging data to identify opportunities, investigating and sizing them, facilitating measurement of the impact of our efforts and developing/maintaining dashboards to report on our progress.

This role reports directly to the Head of Growth and while the role will operate on a remote basis, you will be required to occasionally be onsite in our San Francisco co-working space for meetings and team events.

Your Responsibilities


Create dashboards to direct, track, and gamify various teams' activities to drive desired outcomes
Use data to find opportunity areas for teams/initiatives to drive growth
Design experiments and measure the effectiveness of features/solutions
Design OKRs
Drive weekly outcomes by identifying insights and driving stakeholder alignment on the problem we are solving.
Perform ad-hoc analysis to set weekly goals.


About You


5-8 years experience in an analytical / strategy role (strong preference for product-focused experience).
Comfortable running complex queries in SQL.
Knowledge of growth strategies in a high growth startup environment.
You thrive in an ambiguous and ever changing environment.
You are excited by marketplaces and understand the metrics and ecosystem dynamics underpinning them.
You have exceptional communication skills and empathy that allow you to present complex/technical/mathematical topics to any audience at their level.
You exhibit a growth mindset through leaning and being intellectually curious.
You believe in Roo's mission and respect our customers enough to become obsessed with improving the work life of animal health professionals.


While we are a remote first company, if you are based in San Francisco this will be a hybrid role. Please see below for examples of compensation ranges based on state averages.

Exact compensation may vary based on skills, experience, and location.

California pay range

$150,000—$190,000 USD

New York pay range

$150,000—$190,000 USD

Washington pay range

$145,000—$170,000 USD

Colorado pay range

$125,000—$165,000 USD

Texas pay range

$125,000—$165,000 USD

North Carolina pay range

$120,000—$155,000 USD

Core Values

Our Core Values are what shape us as an organization and we're looking for people who exhibit the same values in their professional life; Bias to Urgency, Drive Measurable Impact, Seek Understanding, Solve Customer Problems and Have Fun!

What to expect from working at Roo!

For permanent, full time employees, we offer:


Accelerated growth & learning potential.
Stipends for home office setup, continuing education, and monthly wellness.
Comprehensive health benefits to fit your needs with base medical plan covered at 100% with optional premium buy up plans.
401K
Unlimited Paid Time Off.
Paid Maternity/Paternity and reproductive care leave.
Gifts on your birthday & anniversary.
Opportunity for domestic travel, including for regional team building events.


Overall, you would be part of a mission-driven company that will significantly empower the lives of all veterinary professionals and the health of the overall animal industry that seeks massive innovation.

We have diverse, passionate & driven team members from a variety of backgrounds, and Roo is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or veteran status. We are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees and candidates. We understand that your individual experience may not check every box but we still encourage you to apply even if you are not confident in every expectation listed.

Ready to join the Roo-volution?!

Title: Business Systems Analyst
Description:
We are seeking a highly skilled Business Systems Analyst (BSA) with expertise in Data Science, AI/ML technologies, and OpenAI ecosystems. The ideal candidate will bridge the gap between business needs and technical implementation, driving AI/ML initiatives and ensuring seamless project execution. This role requires a deep understanding of Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG), Large Language Models (LLMs), and AI-powered solutions, along with strong analytical and communication skills.




Key Responsibilities:




Requirement Gathering & Translation:

Collaborate with stakeholders to gather and translate business requirements into technical specifications for AI/ML-driven solutions, including RAG, LLMs, and OpenAI APIs.
Define use cases and success metrics for AI/ML projects.

Cross-Functional Collaboration:

Work closely with data scientists, engineers, and business stakeholders to align project goals and ensure successful delivery.
Act as a liaison between technical teams and non-technical stakeholders to ensure clear communication and understanding.

AI/ML Solution Development:

Support the integration of AI models into existing systems and workflows.
Assist in the development and optimization of data pipelines for AI/ML projects.
Ensure adherence to AI governance and ethical AI practices.

Data Analysis & Visualization:

Analyze data to derive actionable insights and support strategic decision-making.
Create visualizations and reports to communicate findings to stakeholders.

Project Management & Best Practices:

Utilize Agile methodologies and tools like JIRA to manage project timelines and deliverables.
Ensure documentation of processes, requirements, and technical specifications.

Technical Expertise:

Leverage knowledge of LangChain, Vector Databases, NLP, and AI-powered search systems to enhance solutions.
Stay updated on emerging trends in AI/ML, LLMs, and OpenAI technologies.




Qualifications:

5+ years of experience in business analysis, data science, or AI/ML-related projects.
Strong understanding of AI/ML concepts, including LLMs, RAG, and OpenAI APIs.
Experience with cloud platforms such as AWS, Azure, or GCP.
Proficiency in Agile methodologies and project management tools like JIRA.
Knowledge of LangChain, Vector Databases, NLP, and AI governance frameworks.
Experience deploying AI-powered search and knowledge management systems.
Strong problem-solving, documentation, and communication skills.

Preferred Skills:

Familiarity with data pipeline tools (e.g., Apache Airflow, Databricks).
Experience with AI model deployment and MLOps practices.
Knowledge of data privacy regulations and ethical AI principles.
Certifications in AI/ML, cloud platforms, or business analysis (e.g., CBAP, PMI-PBA).

Show more

  • Assist in the development and optimization of data pipelines for AI/ML projects.
  • Ensure adherence to AI governance and ethical AI practices.

Data Analysis & Visualization:

  • Analyze data to derive actionable insights and support strategic decision-making.
  • Create visualizations and reports to communicate findings to stakeholders.

Project Management & Best Practices:

  • Utilize Agile methodologies and tools like JIRA to manage project timelines and deliverables.
  • Ensure documentation of processes, requirements, and technical specifications.

Technical Expertise:

  • Leverage knowledge of LangChain, Vector Databases, NLP, and AI-powered search systems to enhance solutions.
  • Stay updated on emerging trends in AI/ML, LLMs, and OpenAI technologies.


Qualifications:

  • 5+ years of experience in business analysis, data science, or AI/ML-related projects.
  • Strong understanding of AI/ML concepts, including LLMs, RAG, and OpenAI APIs.
  • Experience with cloud platforms such as AWS, Azure, or GCP.
  • Proficiency in Agile methodologies and project management tools like JIRA.
  • Knowledge of LangChain, Vector Databases, NLP, and AI governance frameworks.
  • Experience deploying AI-powered search and knowledge management systems.
  • Strong problem-solving, documentation, and communication skills.

Preferred Skills:

  • Familiarity with data pipeline tools (e.g., Apache Airflow, Databricks).
  • Experience with AI model deployment and MLOps practices.
  • Knowledge of data privacy regulations and ethical AI principles.
  • Certifications in AI/ML, cloud platforms, or business analysis (e.g., CBAP, PMI-PBA).

Title: Senior Security Data Analyst
Description:
We are seeking a highly motivated and experienced Senior Security Data Analyst to join our Security and Trust (S&T) team. In this role, you will enhance Everlaw’s security posture by analyzing security data to uncover key insights and trends, developing data-driven solutions, and improving team efficiency through automation of governance, compliance and security operations processes. Your expertise in business intelligence, analytics, and automation will play a critical role in strengthening our security strategy.

The ideal candidate has a strong background in security analytics and intelligence, with experience in SIEM tools, security telemetry, and log analysis. You excel at identifying trends and anomalies to enhance security decision-making and possess strong scripting and problem-solving skills to optimize security operations and compliance processes through automation. In this role, you will partner with cross-functional teams to develop dashboards, manage security tools, and automate security processes, ensuring alignment with Everlaw’s security mission and objectives.

Everlaw’s mission is to promote justice by illuminating truth. Our company culture is open and vibrant and we’re committed to the professional growth of our team members, offering an annual learning and development stipend and regular check-ins with managers regarding career goals. If you’re looking for a place that values passion, integrity, thinking big, and a desire to learn, we’d love to hear from you! Think you’re missing some of the skills and are hesitant to apply? We do not believe in the ‘perfect’ candidate and encourage you to apply if you feel you can bring value to our team.

This is a full-time position based in our Oakland, California office with a hybrid work schedule: in office M/W/Th with the option to work from home Tu/Fr.

Getting started


We want you to feel like part of the team early on! Our onboarding process will integrate you into the company with informative sessions on our product, policies, processes, and team structure and goals. You’ll spend meaningful time getting to know your direct reports and discover what excites and challenges them.
We’re excited for you to learn, grow, and contribute right away! We trust that you’ll bring experience and knowledge that will uplift and uplevel the team, but we don’t expect you to know everything on Day 1.


In your role, you'll...


Design, configure, and manage corporate SIEM tools to enhance threat detection and incident response.
Optimize alerting mechanisms to reduce noise and false positives, ensuring security teams focus on high-fidelity threats.
Aggregate and analyze corporate security events across multiple telemetry sources to identify trends, anomalies, and emerging threats.
Collaborate with corporate security engineers to improve rule sets, fine-tune detections, and enhance threat intelligence integration.
Develop and maintain security and compliance dashboards to provide visibility into program effectiveness.
Track security KPIs, compliance trends, and incident response metrics, surfacing insights for leadership and stakeholders.
Automate security and compliance reporting
Analyze security initiative data (e.g., phishing campaigns, security awareness programs) to identify trends, measure effectiveness, and provide actionable insights for continuous improvement.
Identify opportunities to automate manual security and compliance workflows, improving operational efficiency.
Optimize security and compliance tools (e.g., SIEM, CSPM, Trust Portal, audit evidence collection platforms) to meet team needs.
Support the implementation and management of the Customer Trust Portal, ensuring smooth interactions with customers regarding security concerns.
Automate compliance audit evidence gathering and responses to customer RFIs related to security and compliance, improving response accuracy and turnaround time.
Streamline customer security request intake and tracking, developing dashboards to measure KPI and SLA performance.


About You


You have a Bachelor's degree in IT, Information Security, Information Management, Computer Science, or a related field.
You have over 5 years of experience as a Security Analyst, Data Analyst/Engineer or an Information Security Analyst, with at least 3 years in building automation and dashboards.
You have a good understanding of security concepts such as role based access, endpoint protection, vulnerability management, etc.
You have strong scripting skills, such as experience with SQL and/or Python skills.
You have excellent communication skills, both written and verbal, with the ability to work with technical and non-technical stakeholders.
You are authorized to work in the United States. Please note that at this time, Everlaw is not sponsoring F-1 visas, including OPT, for this role.


Benefits


The expected salary range for this role is between $150,000.00 - $185,000.00. The final offered salary will be dependent upon many factors including the candidate’s experience and skills. The base pay range is subject to change in the future.
Equity program
401(k) retirement plan with company matching
Health, dental, and vision
Flexible Spending Accounts for health and dependent care expenses
Paid parental leave and approximately 10 days (80 hours) per year of sick leave
Seventeen paid vacation days plus 11 federal holidays
Membership to Modern Health to help employees prioritize mental health and wellness
Annual allocation for Learning & Development opportunities and applicable professional membership dues
Company-sponsored life and disability insurance
Find out more about our Benefits and Perks


Perks


Work in Uptown Oakland, just steps from the BART line and dozens of restaurants and walking distance to Lake Merritt
Flexible work-from-home days on Tuesdays and Fridays
Monthly home internet reimbursement
Select your preference of hardware (Mac or PC) and customize your desk setup
Enjoy a wide variety of snacks and beverages in the office
Bond over company-wide out-of-the-box events and fun activities with your team
Time off for company-sponsored volunteer events and 4 paid hours per quarter to volunteer at a charitable organization of your choice
Take advantage of learning and career development opportunities
Ranked #9 on Glassdoor's Best Places to Work 2023 for US small and medium companies
One of Wealthfront’s 2021 Career Launching Companies, and ranked #2 on the “2022 Bay Area Best Places to Work” list by the San Francisco Business Times and the Silicon Valley Business Journal
One of Fast Company’s World's Most Innovative Companies for 2022 and proud contributor of free ediscovery resources to benefit the greater good through “Everlaw for Good”


Pursue Truth While Finding Yours

At Everlaw, we are deeply invested in pursuing the truth, for our clients and for our employees. We know that when you’re empowered to pursue your passions, it is reflected in the work. That’s why we’re committed to the professional growth of all our team members, offering an annual learning and development stipend and regular career check-ins with managers. If you’re looking for a place that values passion, integrity, and a desire to learn, we’d love to hear from you!

About Everlaw

We help law firms, government agencies, and corporations sift through millions of documents of evidence in big lawsuits and investigations to find the proverbial smoking gun (or needle in the haystack -- pick your metaphor). It's a multi-billion dollar space typically dominated by service-oriented vendors, and we're coming at it with cutting-edge technology and elegant design. It's working, and we've been growing very rapidly: we host hundreds of terabytes of data and work with all 50 state Attorneys General and hundreds of law firms on some of the most high-profile cases litigated today.

Everlaw is an equal opportunity employer. We pride ourselves on having a diverse workforce and we do not discriminate against any employee or applicant because of race, creed, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity/expression, national origin, disability, age, genetic information, veteran status, marital status, pregnancy or related condition, or any other basis protected by law. We respect the gender, gender identity and gender expression of our applicants and employees, and we honor requests for pronouns. It is our policy to comply with all applicable national, state and local laws pertaining to nondiscrimination and equal opportunity, including the California Equal Pay Act. Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.

Everlaw requires all of its employees to be fully vaccinated for COVID-19, unless a medical or religious exemption applies. If you are hired, we will require you to prove that you have received the COVID-19 vaccine, unless you have received a medical or religious exemption.

We collect and process the personal information you provided along with your job application in accordance with our Applicants Privacy Notice and Notice at Collection.

Title: Technical Data Analyst
Description:
About US: We are a company that provides innovative, transformative IT services and solutions. We are passionate about helping our clients achieve their goals and exceed their expectations. We strive to provide the best possible experience for our clients and employees. We are committed to continuous improvement and innovation, and we are always looking for ways to improve our services and solutions. We believe in working collaboratively with our clients and employees to achieve success.

DS Technologies Inc is looking for Technical Data Analyst role for one of our premier clients.

Job Title: Technical Data Analyst (Full time role) (No C2C, No Contract)

Location: Bay Area, CA (Hybrid)

Industry: Technology (Software & Data Analytics)

Job Category: Data Analytics & Engineering

Application Process

To move forward, candidates are required to complete the AI test using the link below And Further Step Move Forward For Submission After Completion Of Test

micro ai link :- -https://www.interview.micro1.ai/intro/dc1838d2-367f-4c54-b907-96e9463ff98e/?skill=f2708540-cd49-4fa8-a970-4669e39e6174&ping=ok

Overview

The Technical Data Analyst will be responsible for conducting quantitative data analysis, leveraging SQL, AWS, and data modeling tools to derive insights and optimize business decisions. The role requires strong analytical thinking, data processing expertise, and the ability to communicate complex technical information effectively.

Position

Technical Data Analyst (Full Time Role)

Responsibilities


Perform quantitative data analysis to support business decisions.
Write advanced SQL queries to extract, segment, and aggregate data from data warehouses.
Utilize relational, NoSQL, and stream processing systems for data query and processing.
Work with AWS services like Redshift, Athena, and other core AWS components.
Apply data modeling techniques and analytical tools (Python, R, or PyCharm).
Conduct end-to-end quantitative and qualitative analysis to solve complex problems.
Communicate technical insights to executives and non-technical stakeholders.
Work with instrumentation, clickstream data, and business systems such as Salesforce, Amazon Connect, and EWFM.


Required Qualifications:


5+ years of experience in quantitative data analysis.
Bachelor's degree in Engineering, Computer Science, Statistics, Analytics, or related field (or equivalent experience).
Advanced SQL skills for data extraction and aggregation.
Familiarity with data processing tools and data modeling concepts.
Experience with AWS services (Redshift, Athena, and core AWS concepts).
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with a self-starter mindset.
Excellent communication skills to convey technical insights clearly.
Ability to prioritize tasks and manage time effectively.


Preferred Qualifications:


Experience with business system interactions such as Salesforce, Amazon Connect, and EWFM.
Passion for learning, continuous improvement, and innovation.


Candidate Details:

Seeking a highly analytical Technical Data Analyst with expertise in SQL, AWS, and data modeling to drive data-driven insights and optimize decision-making processes.

If you are interested, Kindly share your resume to

Rajesh.d@dstechnologiesinc.com

Priya@dstechnologiesinc.com

Thanks

DS Technologies - Team

Title: Data Analyst, Quality Data Analytics
Description:
Reporting to the Manager of Quality Data Analytics, the Data Analyst will manage the analysis and reporting of data supporting Quality Initiatives in Health Services. The Data Analyst will help increase the use of data in clinical decision-making and improving data quality by identifying data gaps impacting Health Services Quality Initiatives including Quality Improvement and Population Health Management. You will support quality reporting for the Medi-Cal and D-SNP lines of business.




The Quality Data Analytics (QDA) team values collaboration and teamwork, as the team works with other teams, from clinical staff to our ITS Department, and external partners such as providers and regulatory agencies




SFHP is proud to offer a hybrid work environment. As such, this role will be required to be onsite, in office a minimum of 4 days per month.




Salary: $80,000 to 100,000 per year.




WHAT YOU WILL DO:

Perform accurate data analysis, trending, and reporting.
Resolve data quality issues affecting HEDIS and Star Ratings performance and other Quality Initiatives.
Validate our requirements for exchange of data between healthcare systems.
Identify new ways to integrate existing data sources or reports from several internal or external stakeholders supporting the programs managed by the Quality Data Analytics team including CMS, DMHC, DHCS, and NCQA reporting
Design and develop reports using the data from the Quality Reporter and Jiva applications.
Ensure the integrity of data being reported and used is accurate and valid.
Interface with users and other stakeholders to achieve mutually agreeable deliverables, timeframes, resources, and outcomes.
Be a liaison with Data Management, Business Analytics and other ITS teams for any changes or updates in data exchanges.
Coordinate small projects following standardized project management methodologies.
Coordinate materials for SFHP committees and meetings that have direct impact on the programs managed by the Quality Data Analytics team.




WHAT YOU WILL BRING:

Bachelor's degree in MIS, Business, Public Health, or other relevant areas; or equivalent work experience.
2 to 3 years of experience with Medi-Cal and Medicare quality reporting including HEDIS and STAR ratings.
2 to 3 years of experience in health plan operations, health care clinical/data quality improvement, direct patient care, or other experience directly related to position responsibilities and knowledge.
Familiarity with technologies including Cotiviti Quality Reporter, QNXT, and Jiva is helpful.
Experience in health care data sets impacting Quality Initiatives and Measures including HEDIS, Member, Provider, Claim, Encounter, Lab, Electronic Health Record (EHR), and Pharmacy data.
Experience in data analysis and problem-solving skills.
Advanced proficiency in SQL, including report development.




WHAT WE OFFER:

Health Benefits
Medical: You'll have a choice of medical plans, including options from Kaiser and Blue Shield of California, heavily subsidized by SFHP.
Dental: You'll have a choice of a basic dental plan or an enhanced dental plan which includes orthodontic coverage.
Vision: Employee vision care coverage is available through Vision Service Plan (VSP).
Retirement – Employer-matched CalPERS Pension and 401(a) plans, 457 Plan.
Time off – 23 days of Paid Time Off (PTO) and 13 paid holidays.
Professional development: Opportunities for tuition reimbursement, professional license/membership.




ABOUT SFHP:

Established in 1997, San Francisco Health Plan (SFHP) is an award-winning, managed care health plan whose mission is to provide affordable health care coverage to the underserved low and moderate-income residents in San Francisco County. SFHP is chosen by eight out of every ten San Francisco Medi-Cal managed care enrollees and its 175,000+ members have access to a full spectrum of medical services including preventive care, specialty care, hospitalization, prescription drugs, and family planning services.




San Francisco Health Plan is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to a work environment that supports, inspires, and respects all individuals and in which our people processes are applied without discrimination on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, age, disability, national or ethnic origin, military service status, citizenship, or other protected characteristics.




Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.




San Francisco Health Plan is an E-Verify participating employer.




Hiring priority will be given to candidates residing in the San Francisco Bay Area and California.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
ANALYST

StrataVision AI, Inc. Data Analyst San Carlos, CA Perform statistical modeling & analysis on structured & unstructured data to create metrics, reports, & visualizations of trends. Collaborate with tech teams & business users to understand data needs & develop reqs. Work with dev & data mgmt to capture data from internal & external sources. Maintain statistical models for ongoing & ad hoc analysis, using data viz tools to create dash-boards, reports, & presentations that support data storytelling & business insights. Title: Master Data Analyst
Description:
Job Title: Master Data Analyst (Quality Assurance Specialist)

Pay rate: Can go up to $82 per hour

Duration: 12 months

W2 contract only (No C2C)

Location- Fremont, CA, 94538




Job Details

Work Model: Hybrid – typically 3 days a week onsite, occasionally up to 5 days depending on business needs.
Degree Requirement: Yes.

Top 3 Skills:

Data Management and Systems Governance – Background with Master Data and ERP systems as a business user (not IT-related).
Advanced Excel Skills – Ability to go beyond basic functions, including pivot tables, power queries, and lookup functions.
Critical Thinking and Communication – Ability to analyze and collaborate to resolve non-routine system issues using independent judgment and work within a project setting.
Interview Process: Preferably two rounds, with the final interview onsite.

.

Project Overview & Daily Activities

Projects:

Execute a structured approach to the end-to-end systems setup for product launches and projects, including material creation in SAP MDG.
Support quality projects and initiatives such as reworks and recalls.




Daily Activities:

Sustain master and transactional data across ERP and partner systems, including product and batch information.
Perform data analytics activities for quality systems data.
Resolve unanticipated system issues independently or within a cross-functional team.




Job Summary:

The Data Management Specialist will be responsible for maintaining and managing accurate data for new product launches and existing products. This role involves collaborating with new product launch teams, project team members, and business process owners to ensure data integrity and effective business operations.




Key Responsibilities:

Maintain Master and Transactional Data across ERP and partner systems.
Perform data analytics activities for quality systems data.
Identify actionable insights for the business and cross-functional teams.
Support quality projects and initiatives.
Respond to business requests related to data management and analysis.




Qualifications & Skills:

Experience with Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) systems such as Oracle, SAP, etc.
Advanced Microsoft Excel skills, including formulas, pivot tables, and trend analysis.
Knowledge of Business Intelligence and analytics platforms (e.g., Power BI, Tableau).
Strong analytical skills with the ability to conduct systematic data analysis.
Ability to manage multiple priorities and workflows in a fast-paced environment.
Strong organizational and critical thinking skills to assess problems and find solutions.
Independent, proactive, results-oriented, and self-motivated with a commitment to excellence.
Experience collaborating with cross-functional teams and presenting business insights.
Proven ability to handle multiple projects and meet deadlines.




*** If this position may be interested to you, please email me back at somp767@kellyservices.com with your most up to date resume in word format) and advise the best time and number at which you can be reached****

Title: BI Data Analyst
Description:
BI Data Analyst – Uncover Insights, Power Decisions, and Drive Business Intelligence!

Are you passionate about turning data into powerful business insights, building dynamic dashboards, and optimizing key metrics? As a Business Intelligence (BI) Data Analyst at The Pasha Group, you’ll play a critical role in transforming raw data into meaningful analytics that drive smarter decision-making. If you love digging into data, designing intuitive reports, and shaping BI strategy, this is your opportunity to make an impact and elevate data-driven success!

Your Mission: Analyze, Innovate & Optimize


Turn Data into Actionable Insights – Collect, analyze, and define Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) that help leadership make informed decisions.
Design Next-Level BI Dashboards – Build interactive, visually compelling reports and dashboards using Power BI, Tableau, or SAP Business Objects.
Mine & Transform Data – Extract, clean, and structure data from multiple internal and external sources, ensuring accuracy and usability.
Enable Smarter Decision-Making – Conduct deep root cause analysis, variance assessments, and data storytelling to provide context and clarity.
Optimize BI Strategy – Contribute to continuous improvement of BI standards, protocols, and reporting best practices.
Ensure Data Integrity – Document data dictionaries, test metric accuracy, and perform QA testing to drive consistency across all reports.
Drive Business Adoption – Train end-users on BI tools, dashboard functionalities, and best practices, improving data literacy across teams.


What You Bring To The Table


Education: Bachelor's degree in Business, Computer Science, or related field.
Experience:
3+ years of hands-on experience in data analytics, reporting, and business intelligence.
2+ years of designing and maintaining reports, dashboards, and KPIs using BI tools.
Technical Expertise:
Proficiency with Power BI, Tableau, SAP Business Objects, or Power Pivot.
Strong knowledge of SQL Queries and database structures.
Understanding of data warehousing concepts, dimensions, measures, and hierarchies.
Analytical & Critical Thinking – Ability to interpret complex data sets, identify trends, and provide strategic recommendations.
Exceptional Communication Skills – Ability to translate data insights into business-friendly language, enabling clear and impactful storytelling.
Creative Problem-Solving – Capable of identifying gaps in data, improving BI processes, and implementing scalable reporting solutions.


Why Join The Pasha Group?


Be a Data Champion – Shape how business intelligence drives key decisions in a dynamic, industry-leading organization.
Work on Cutting-Edge BI Solutions – Leverage advanced analytics tools and methodologies to build powerful reporting systems.
Collaborate with Industry Experts – Work alongside business leaders, data engineers, and IT professionals to create meaningful insights.
Make a Real Impact – Your work will improve operational efficiency, optimize performance metrics, and transform business strategies.


Additional Details


Work Environment: Corporate office setting with cross-functional collaboration.
Travel: Up to 15% travel to U.S. locations, including Hawaii.
Physical Requirements: Frequent data analysis, report development, and business intelligence strategy execution.


If you’re a data-driven problem solver ready to elevate BI strategy and transform analytics into action, apply today and be a key player in The Pasha Group’s data revolution!

Screening Requirements

Background Checks

Must be fully vaccinated against COVID-19, except as prohibited by law.

The information included in this description has been designed to indicate the general nature and level of work performed by employees within this classification. It is not designed to contain or be interpreted as a comprehensive or exhaustive inventory of all duties, responsibilities, and qualifications required of employees assigned to this job.

The salary range listed is based on the geographic zone associated with this role: San Rafael, CA. If you are applying to work from a different location, the salary range may vary to align with the cost of labor and market conditions in that area. For applicants from other zones, we encourage you to reach out to us to confirm the relevant salary range for your specific location. Starting pay will be determined by job-related factors including experience, education, and business needs and may be modified at any time.

Zone 1: $100,000 - $130,000

The Pasha Group family of companies are EOE/AA Employers - Minority/Female/Veteran/Disabled/and other Protected Categories

Title: Lead Data Analyst
Description:
We're looking for a Lead Data Analyst to join Navan, Inc.'s global Data team. You'll work with stakeholders from across the business, including finance, commerce, engineering, sales, and operations, to define data needs and products that drive the company forward. We need someone with exceptional data skills and a business mindset who can manage multiple moving pieces and deliver value to customers.

What You’ll Do


Lead cross-functional collaborations with Finance, Engineering, Sales, and Operations to deliver data-driven solutions and strategic insights.
Manage and mentor a team of data analysts, ensuring high-quality reporting and analysis.
Partner with financial stakeholders to build and refine financial models for strategic planning.
Oversee the creation of operational and financial reports, presenting insights to senior management.
Drive self-service analytics by developing training programs for BI tools (e.g., Tableau).
Consolidate data across units and acquisitions, ensuring consistency in definitions and reporting standards.
Lead process improvements for reporting and analytics efficiency, optimizing tools and methodologies.
Support ad-hoc requests, focusing on financial reconciliations and complex reporting needs.
Provide actionable insights on financial performance to guide key business decisions.


What We’re Looking For


8+ years in Data Analysis, with 5+ years in a leadership role.
Expertise in SQL, Tableau, and financial reporting.
Strong leadership skills with a track record of mentoring and guiding teams.
Advanced knowledge of statistical techniques and financial analysis.
Proven ability to work with large datasets and ensure reporting accuracy.
Excellent communication skills, with the ability to present complex insights to diverse audiences.
Experience with process automation and driving efficiency across data operations.


The posted pay range represents the anticipated low and high end of the compensation for this position and is subject to change based on business need. To determine a successful candidate’s starting pay, we carefully consider a variety of factors, including primary work location, an evaluation of the candidate’s skills and experience, market demands, and internal parity.For roles with on-target-earnings (OTE), the pay range includes both base salary and target incentive compensation. Target incentive compensation for some roles may include a ramping draw period. Compensation is higher for those who exceed targets. Candidates may receive more information from the recruiter.

Pay Range: $142,500 USD - $261,000 USD

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst - Commercial
Description:
Company Overview

Embark on an enriching journey with PROCEPT BioRobotics, where our vision, mission, and values guide everything we do as a company. We are committed to revolutionizing treatment for benign prostatic hyperplasia (BPH, otherwise known as prostate gland enlargement) through innovation in surgical robotics. As our company succeeds and grows, we improve the quality of life of patients, provide more effective treatment options for surgeons, uphold the trust of our shareholders. That starts with a commitment to our People with a focus on creating an evolving landscape for your career, brimming with transformative opportunities that provide continuous career growth opportunities.




The Opportunity That Awaits You:         

We are seeking a highly analytical and business-savvy Business Intelligence Analyst to join our Commercial Team. In this role, you will leverage data-driven insights, machine learning models, and automation to optimize revenue growth, enhance go-to-market strategies, and improve overall commercial performance. You will partner with key stakeholders across sales, marketing, finance, and our executive team to drive strategic initiatives that impact business outcomes.




What Your Day-To-Day Will Involve:
Lead deep-dive analyses into sales trends, pricing optimization, customer segmentation, and market performance to uncover revenue opportunities
Develop, maintain, and automate scalable business intelligence dashboards and reports to track key commercial KPIs
Build and refine predictive models to support demand forecasting and customer lifetime value analysis
Analyze the impact of marketing programs, campaigns, and promotional tactics on revenue, customer acquisition, and retention
Measure marketing ROI by tracking performance across digital and offline channels, customer engagement, and conversion rates
Support marketing mix modeling and attribution analysis to understand which channels and tactics drive the highest business impact
Identify opportunities for marketing optimization through data-driven insights, ensuring alignment with overall commercial goals
Extract, clean, and structure large datasets from multiple sources (CRM, ERP, third-party data providers) for advanced analytics and strategic insights
Automate data workflows using AI-driven tools and frameworks to enhance reporting efficiency and real-time decision-making
Utilize AI and machine learning models to enhance customer segmentation, churn prediction, and sales forecasting, and optimize marketing spend and campaign effectiveness
Present analytical findings in a compelling, storytelling-driven format to senior executives and business leaders
Continuously improve data processes, ensuring accuracy, efficiency, and scalability





The Qualifications We Need You to Possess
Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Data Science, Business Analytics, Economics, Mathematics, Statistics, or a related field
3+ years of experience in data analysis, commercial strategy, or business intelligence
Expertise in SQL for querying and manipulating large datasets
Proficiency in data visualization tools such as Tableau, Power BI, or Looker, with experience in creating executive-level dashboards
Strong analytical skills with experience in Python or R for statistical analysis, forecasting, and machine learning applications
Deep understanding of commercial KPIs, revenue drivers, and sales performance metrics
Experience working with CRM (Salesforce), ERP, and marketing automation platforms to analyze commercial performance
Ability to translate complex data findings into clear, strategic recommendations for non-technical stakeholders
Strong communication and presentation skills, with an ability to influence decision-making





The Qualifications We Like You to Possess
Experience in marketing analytics, attribution modeling, and campaign performance tracking is a plus
Medical Device/ Healthcare industry experince is a plus








For US-Based Candidates Only

Work Authorization Status: Citizen / Permanent Resident

 

For this role, the anticipated base pay range is $120,000-140,000 per year.

Plus, eligibility for an annual bonus and equity/RSUs




Understanding PROCEPT's Culture

At PROCEPT, we believe every person matters. Every employee, every patient, every caregiver. Because we are here to create a revolution, and we believe in doing that by innovating everywhere with pathological optimism. We believe in being humble and highly engaged in the work we do, while also working together seamlessly for a common goal. At Procept, curiosity, ingenuity and conviction in the power technology will transform the lives of our patients and providers.

 

And this doesn’t happen by accident. It starts with our live induction program that serves as an incubator for cross-functional team building, an immersion in Procept’s history, jam-packed interactive sessions with executive leadership and a crash-course in the mission and purpose of what we do. It continues with our one-of-a-kind management program designed to build the best managers in the industry, where our people managers across functions come together to exchange ideas and grow, as both managers and learners, in an environment that challenges, supports and broadens.

 

We are fueled by the opportunity to give people their lives back. And we believe that it begins with YOU! At Procept, we push beyond just finding a work/life balance, we strive to find a work/life blend, a professional world that you are honored and impassioned to belong to, one that you can proudly share with your family, friends, and acquaintances.

 

An opportunity at PROCEPT BioRobotics won’t just be about finding a job. It will be an opportunity for you to join a community devoted to making a difference in this world!

 

BENEFITS OF WORKING AT PROCEPT! 

PROCEPT’s health and wellness benefits for employees are second to none in the industry. As an organization, one of our top priorities is to maintain the health and wellbeing of our employees and their families. We offer a comprehensive benefits package that includes full medical coverage, wellness programs, on-site gym, a 401(k) plan with employer match, short-term and long-term disability coverage, basic life insurance, wellbeing benefits, flexible or paid time off, paid parental leave, paid holidays, and many more!

 

EQUAL EMPLOYMENT OPPORTUNITY STATEMENT

PROCEPT BioRobotics is an equal opportunity employer that is committed to diversity and inclusion in the workplace. We prohibit discrimination and harassment of any kind on the basis of race, color, national origin, religion, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, genetic information, pregnancy, age, or any other protected status set forth in federal, state, or local laws. This policy applies to all employment practices within our organization.

 

PAY RANGE TRANSPARENCY

Procept is committed to fair and equitable compensation practices. The pay range(s) for this role is listed below and represents base salary range for non-commissionable roles or on-target earnings for commissionable roles. Actual compensation packages are based on several factors that are unique to each candidate, including but not limited to job-related skills, depth of experience, relevant certifications and training, and specific work location. Based on the factors above, Procept utilizes the full width of the range. The total compensation package for this position may also include eligibility for annual performance bonus, equity, and the benefits listed above.

 

WORK ENVIRONMENT

We’ll provide you training for, and ask you to maintain trained status for, and comply with, all relevant aspects of the PROCEPT BioRobotics Quality Management System to ensure product and support regulatory compliance. We would also ask you to understand and adhere to the PROCEPT BioRobotics Quality & EHS policies.

Show more

We’ll provide you training for, and ask you to maintain trained status for, and comply with, all relevant aspects of the PROCEPT BioRobotics Quality Management System to ensure product and support regulatory compliance. We would also ask you to understand and adhere to the PROCEPT BioRobotics Quality & EHS policies.

Title: Operations Data Analyst
Description:
As the first Operations Data Analyst at Kikoff, you will help shape the future of our Operations organization. This is a great opportunity to use your data expertise, analytical mindset, and cross-functional collaboration skills to optimize how our Operations team works and drives impact.

About The Role

The Operations organization at Kikoff handles diverse responsibilities, including customer support, fraud prevention, prioritizing customer feedback, and collaborating with Product and Engineering teams. As the first Operations Data Analyst, you’ll report directly to the Operations team while receiving mentorship from the Data team. You’ll tackle high-impact projects that blend data analysis with strategic thinking to enhance our operations.

What You’ll Do

Your key responsibilities will include projects such as:


Forecasting Workforce Needs: Use data to ensure we understand resource and staffing needs to meet customer demands.
Improving Customer Experience: Investigate and analyze customer issues and unhappy paths. Identify trends and actionable solutions, and develop business cases to prioritize effectively.
Enhancing AI Chatbot Performance: Pull and analyze data from AI-powered chatbot conversations to improve outcomes.
Empowering the Team: Support teammates by automating analyses and writing SQL queries to evaluate the effectiveness of operations strategies and decisions.
Strengthening Fraud Prevention: Develop data-driven methods to enhance fraud detection and prevention strategies.


This role offers significant growth potential, with opportunities to take on new responsibilities or evolve into more advanced roles as the team grows, depending on your skills and interests.

Qualifications


2+ years of experience in a Data Analyst, Data Scientist, or similar role
Fluent in SQL
Proficient in statistics and probability
Proficient in Excel or Google Sheets
Excellent communication skills—you can translate complex data into clear, actionable insights
Business acumen and ability to adapt recommendations to diverse objectives
Proven ability to work on multiple projects and navigate ambiguous situations with multiple stakeholders


About Kikoff

Kikoff is a personal finance platform designed to help millions of underserved Americans achieve financial wellness. Our mission is to provide refreshingly fair, effective, and simple pathways for everyday people to meet their financial goals. We design financial products that simplify credit building so our users can reach their financial goals. Kikoff is a Series B company and has raised over $42 million in total funding. Investors include Portage Ventures, Lightspeed Venture Partners, GGV, Coatue, Core Innovation Capital, and basketball star Stephen Curry. Kikoff was founded in 2019 and is headquartered in San Francisco with an office in Reno.

Why Kikoff

This is a consumer fintech startup, and you will be working with serial entrepreneurs who have built strong consumer brands and innovative products. We are backed by some of Silicon Valley’s top VCs, including GGV capital, Lightspeed Ventures, Female Founders Fund, and others. We value extreme ownership, clear communication, a strong sense of craftsmanship, and the desire to create lasting work and work relationships. Yes, you can build an exciting business AND have real-life real-customer impact.

🏥 Medical, dental, and vision coverage - Kikoff covers the full cost of health insurance for the employee!

📈 Stock Options

🏝 Flexible vacation policy to help you recharge

💰US salary range for this full-time position consists of base + equity + benefits

Our salary ranges are determined by role and experience: $110,000–$160,000 + equity

Equal Employment Opportunity Statement

Kikoff Inc. is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to complying with all federal, state, and local laws providing equal employment opportunities and considers qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, creed, gender, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, marital status, pregnancy, sex, gender expression or identity, sexual orientation, citizenship, or any other legally protected class.

Please Reference The Following Information For More Information

https://www.eeoc.gov/sites/default/files/migrated_files/employers/poster_screen_reader_optimized.pdf

https://www.dol.gov/ofccp/regs/compliance/posters/pdf/OFCCP_EEO_Supplement_Final_JRF_QA_508c.pdf

If you need reasonable accommodation for a job opening please connect with us at talent@kikoff.com and describe the specific accommodation requested for a disability-related limitation. Reasonable accommodations are modifications or adjustments to the application or hiring process that would enable you to fully participate in that process.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
DATA ANALYST

COMPANY SUMMARY (“Who are we?”)

We are The Honest Kitchen. We’re a team of pet-obsessed foodies, who put our heart and soul into our work – making a line of human-grade whole foods, treats, and supplements for dogs and cats. We’re a rapidly growing business that is a proud B Corp, (which is a legal corporate structure that allows us to operate and make decisions based upon a triple bottom line, factoring in social and environmental impacts right alongside our prioritization of long-term financial sustainability!). We were also named one of Outside Magazine’s Best Places to Work for 6 straight years and certified as a Great Place to Work!

We strive for an inclusive work culture that supports a diverse array of skills, experiences, and perspectives our employees bring to the table. For us, differences are a source of strength. We celebrate strong performance and ethical processes, and we work hard every day to nurture an inclusive culture where all employees can innovate and thrive. Here, you will not only build your career, but you will also uncover new experiences and collaborate with passionate colleagues.

The Honest Kitchen values a diverse workforce. Everyone, including women, people of color, people with disabilities, and members of the LGBTQIA+ community are strongly encouraged to apply. The Honest Kitchen believes that an equitable and inclusive work environment and a diverse, empowered team are key to achieving our mission. We’re looking for candidates who can expand our business culture by bringing their whole, authentic selves to work. We strive to provide all qualified candidates with an equitable and accessible recruitment process.

POSITION SUMMARY ("What are we looking for?")

The Data Analyst will provide support for QA department testing, inspection, and evaluation practices as well as support functions related to materials, production, and incident management. Assists with planning and implementing food safety programs, such as but not limited to, analytical and micro testing, material coordination, non-conforming products, allergen testing compliance, HACCP, Sanitation, and QMS. Initiate and complete food safety incident investigations by using root cause analysis. Complete routine auditing of practices and documentation as assigned as well as review of training, records, and documentation. Complete validation and verification studies of the food safety programs. Complete additional projects related to quality improvements or cost-saving initiatives as assigned. Strong leadership, organizational, and technical skills are required for this position.

This position creates, maintains, and supports Quality Master Data for all products across our portfolio. This position will utilize technical tools to analyze and measure data quality and develop action plans to ensure accuracy, completeness, and compliance.

SCOPE OF POSITION


Collect data from multiple facility settings and suppliers in a variety of forms to collate and analyze for various quality and operational goals
Must be able to work independently to identify trends and actionable opportunities identified from the data analysis
Stay informed of industry trends and technological advances to improve the data collection and analysis process as well as the execution of operational improvements
Collect samples of finished goods from various co-manufacturers and conduct a basic trade survey for these products. Identify trends and report out findings related to these evaluations
Assist with supplier and co-manufacturer corrective actions by initiating SCARS and CAPAs for observed non-conformances. Track SCARS and CAPAs issued by others throughout the organization and assist in having them completed. Report on trends identified with CAPA’s and SCAR’s
Track Controlled Process Changes issued throughout the organization and assist in having them completed. Report on trends identified with CPCs
Assist with mock recalls throughout the supplier and co-manufacturing network and track their completion as well as the potentially resulting corrective actions
Utilize technology to support Quality Assurance activities by leveraging to assist with other team members
Develop and maintain a strong working knowledge of AAFCO Rules, federal, state, and relevant international regulations, and guidelines that affect the pet food industry
Perform other duties as required to support the Quality team or internal stakeholders


EXPERIENCE REQUIRED (“What are we looking for?”)


Must have excellent data analysis skills and be knowledgeable of statistical process control methods
Must be comfortable with technology and adaptable to new software platforms
Must be punctual and dependable to ensure job requirements are met
Ability to work individually as well as with others as a team at all levels
Excellent attention to detail
Must be well organized and able to prioritize multiple tasks simultaneously
Ability to use independent judgment to make decisions and solve problems
High integrity and ability to exercise good judgment
Strong execution orientation with the ability to take the lead when required
Ability to manage schedules and stay on task
Must love animals and be passionate about their health


Qualifications/Technical Expertise:


Proficiency with Microsoft Outlook, Excel, and Word
Understanding of food safety including GMPs, SOPs, and HACCP
Understanding of product development and food manufacturing
SQF practitioner and PCQI preferred


REQUIRED EDUCATION/EXPERIENCE (“What are we looking for?”)


Work experience in the pet food industry is strongly preferred
Bachelor’s degree in Statistics, Computer Science, Food Science, Food Law, Chemistry, or Animal Science is preferred (Equivalent education or work experience might be substituted).


BENEFITS OF WORKING FOR THE HONEST KITCHEN (“What do we offer?”)

We offer a competitive compensation package, including salary and robust employee benefits. Some key highlights include:


Time off: We offer a highly competitive time off schedule, including unlimited vacation and additional sick time, in addition to a generous company-paid holiday schedule
Benefits: Various health insurance plans with generous employer contributions to premiums. We also offer vision, dental, short-term disability, long-term disability, accident, critical illness, an employee assistance program, and an FSA/HSA
Financial wellness: Enjoy perks like a company 401K with an employer match
Mission Driven: Employees can take up to 40 hours of volunteer time a year, and we offer donation matching to non-profit organizations of your choosing
Pet Friendly: Pet-friendly offices, zoom calls, discounts on pet insurance, and of course, free pet food!
Collaborative Team: We offer a fun, team-oriented work environment where you feel like you are making a difference every day


As a Public Benefit Corporation, our company's practices and outputs are assessed and evaluated across five categories: Governance, Workers, Community, The Environment, and Customers. We track our social and environmental impact over time and publicly disclose our performance in our annual impact report.

As an employee of a Certified B Corp, it is required that in performing your role, you factor social and environmental impacts into decision-making and actions as they pertain to your role with The Honest Kitchen, so as to ensure that our actions make a positive impact where possible.


The Honest Kitchen is an equal opportunity employer. The Company’s policy prohibits discrimination based on race, religious creed (which includes religious dress and grooming practices), color, national origin, ancestry, disability, medical condition, genetic information, marital status, sex (which includes pregnancy, childbirth, breastfeeding, and related medical conditions), gender, gender identity, gender expression, age, sexual orientation, military or veteran status

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
About the Company:

Octave is a modern behavioral health practice creating a new standard for care delivery that’s both high-quality and accessible. With in-person and virtual clinics in multiple states, the company offers evidence-based individual, couples, and family therapy, while pioneering relationships with payers to make care more affordable through insurance. By raising the bar on how care is delivered and how providers are supported, we are building a sustainable system that values equity, affordability, and effectiveness.

Job Summary:

Octave is looking for an experienced Senior Data Analyst to join our growing data team. We are looking for an individual to help lay the foundation of analytics and data science at the company with a specific focus on growth and marketing initiatives. The role will help establish operating KPIs and identify opportunities to continue to accelerate the growth of the business. There will be a strong focus on developing engaging data visualizations via dashboards to deliver data driven insights for our business stakeholders. In addition, we will be looking for an individual who can help establish processes and identify opportunities to optimize and scale existing workflows.

We are a full-stack behavioral health services company: we employ therapists, contract with insurance providers for reimbursing care, and run our own tech stack to support across the business. We are a technology-enabled service provider working to increase access to mental health care for insured people in the US. Automation and strong systems are the lynchpin for enabling scale and driving access for more people to get care.

Responsibilities Include:


Partner closely with cross-functional teams, including product managers, analysts, engineers, and business stakeholders, to identify key business problems and develop analytic solutions that drive growth and innovation.
Communicate sophisticated analyses and results to a wide array of business partners with varying levels of technical expertise.
Create and maintain operational dashboards in Tableau to understand company performance over time and enable partners with self-serve tools.
Develop efficient and scalable end to end workflows and identify opportunities to improve existing processes.
Translating business operations and processes into scalable data and reporting.



Preferred Requirements:


4+ years working in analytics/data science preferably with experience at a startup.
4+ years hands on technical analysis work with SQL experience performing complex data transformations. Experience manipulating large data sets and uncovering insights utilizing disparate data sources and tools.
Deep understanding of marketing analytics, including multi-touch attribution models (e.g., first-touch, last-touch, time-decay), media mix modeling, and ROI measurement across channels.
Proven experience using tools like Mixpanel, Google Analytics 4 (GA4), and Tableau to track and analyze marketing performance.
Experience with marketing funnel analysis, including diagnosing drop-offs, conversion bottlenecks, and optimization strategies to improve efficiency.
Track record of improving marketing KPIs, such as CAC, LTV, ROAS, and overall funnel conversion rates through data-driven insights.
Strong analytical skills with the ability to apply business strategy to data analysis and recommendations.
Expert in data visualization (Tableau/Looker/etc).
Strong communication skills. Ability to tell story with data and explain the nuance to stakeholders.
Ability to think strategically (interfacing with senior leaders), while also enjoying being hands-on with the data.
A knack for asking the right questions, then answering them with sound data and analysis.
Experience with dbt/git/aws is a plus.



Octave's Company Values:

The below values drive our day-to-day operations.


We’re human beings first. We operate with empathy and kindness – with our clients, with our collaborators, and with ourselves.
People deserve better than status quo. We’re willing to tackle the intractable problems, no matter how big, because someone should. We ask big questions, we craft big solutions, and we challenge ourselves and others to make it happen.
No bystanders. No stars. No tourists. Each person has been selected to be here, and with that comes a responsibility to bring your expertise, share your ideas, and help make this company better.
Partnership paves the path ahead. We don’t operate in a silo, internally or externally. To transform the system, we believe in working with others to create something bigger, better, and stronger.
Quality is crucial at scale. Quality is core to our business, and we refuse to sacrifice it as we grow.
Progress is a process. In the pursuit of progress, we iterate, reflect, learn, adjust – and always leave things better than we found them.
There are people behind every data point. We recognize that numbers tell only one part of the story, and we also do the work to understand impacts at the individual level



Physical Requirements:


Prolonged periods sitting at a desk and working on a computer.
Must be able to frequently communicate with others through virtual meeting applications such as Zoom and Google Meet.
Must be able to observe and communicate information on company provided laptop.
Move up to 10 pounds on occasion.
Must be eligible to work in the United States without sponsorship now or in the future.



Compensation:

Octave is committed to pay equity. To maintain our commitment to pay equity, Octave will follow Pay Transparency regulations on all open job postings. Current Pay Transparency laws require companies to include a position's salary or hourly wage range (not including bonuses or equity-based compensation) in any internal or external job posting. This requirement extends to job postings published by a third party at an employer's request.

Octave will not discharge or in any other manner discriminate against employees or applicants because they have inquired about, discussed, or disclosed their own pay or the pay of another employee or applicant. However, employees who have access to the compensation information of other employees or applicants as a part of their essential job functions cannot disclose the pay of other employees or applicants to individuals who do not otherwise have access to compensation information, unless the disclosure is (a) in response to a formal complaint or charge, (b) in furtherance of an investigation, proceeding, hearing, or action, including an investigation conducted by the employer, or (c) consistent with Octave’s legal duty to furnish information.

Starting pay for qualified applicants will depend on a combination of job-related factors, which may include education, training, experience, location, business needs, or market demands. The expected salary range for this role is set forth below and this range may be modified in the future.

The salary range is for zone 1 (all states not in zone 2 or zone 3) $132,100 - $142,600.

The salary range for zone 2 (CO, HI, MD, RI) is $145,300 - $156,900.

The salary range for zone 3 (AK, CA, CT, MA, NJ, NY, WA) is $152,000 - $164,000.

All zones are eligible for equity in the form of stock options.

Additionally, this position is eligible for the following benefits: company sponsored life insurance, disability and AD&D plans. Voluntary benefits such as 401k retirement, medical, dental, vision, FSA, HSA, dependent care and commuter/parking options are also available. Octave offers generous Paid Time Off as well as paid parental leave benefits.

This job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities and activities may change at any time with or without notice.

Application Instructions:

Please complete the following application. Please note that the U.S. Equal Opportunity Employment Information questions below are used for the purposes of EEOC reporting and are optional to complete. Octave is unable to change these questions and we acknowledge that many of the U.S. Equal Opportunity Employment Information questions are not inclusive or affirming of all aspects of cultural identity. Octave is committed to an inclusive workplace environment, and this information will not inform how we approach hiring or employment.

The below values drive our day-to-day operations.

  • We’re human beings first. We operate with empathy and kindness – with our clients, with our collaborators, and with ourselves.
  • People deserve better than status quo. We’re willing to tackle the intractable problems, no matter how big, because someone should. We ask big questions, we craft big solutions, and we challenge ourselves and others to make it happen.
  • No bystanders. No stars. No tourists. Each person has been selected to be here, and with that comes a responsibility to bring your expertise, share your ideas, and help make this company better.
  • Partnership paves the path ahead. We don’t operate in a silo, internally or externally. To transform the system, we believe in working with others to create something bigger, better, and stronger.
  • Quality is crucial at scale. Quality is core to our business, and we refuse to sacrifice it as we grow.
  • Progress is a process. In the pursuit of progress, we iterate, reflect, learn, adjust – and always leave things better than we found them.
  • There are people behind every data point. We recognize that numbers tell only one part of the story, and we also do the work to understand impacts at the individual level


Physical Requirements:

  • Prolonged periods sitting at a desk and working on a computer.
  • Must be able to frequently communicate with others through virtual meeting applications such as Zoom and Google Meet.
  • Must be able to observe and communicate information on company provided laptop.
  • Move up to 10 pounds on occasion.
  • Must be eligible to work in the United States without sponsorship now or in the future.


Compensation:

Octave is committed to pay equity. To maintain our commitment to pay equity, Octave will follow Pay Transparency regulations on all open job postings. Current Pay Transparency laws require companies to include a position's salary or hourly wage range (not including bonuses or equity-based compensation) in any internal or external job posting. This requirement extends to job postings published by a third party at an employer's request.

Octave will not discharge or in any other manner discriminate against employees or applicants because they have inquired about, discussed, or disclosed their own pay or the pay of another employee or applicant. However, employees who have access to the compensation information of other employees or applicants as a part of their essential job functions cannot disclose the pay of other employees or applicants to individuals who do not otherwise have access to compensation information, unless the disclosure is (a) in response to a formal complaint or charge, (b) in furtherance of an investigation, proceeding, hearing, or action, including an investigation conducted by the employer, or (c) consistent with Octave’s legal duty to furnish information.

Starting pay for qualified applicants will depend on a combination of job-related factors, which may include education, training, experience, location, business needs, or market demands. The expected salary range for this role is set forth below and this range may be modified in the future.

The salary range is for zone 1 (all states not in zone 2 or zone 3) $132,100 - $142,600.

The salary range for zone 2 (CO, HI, MD, RI) is $145,300 - $156,900.

The salary range for zone 3 (AK, CA, CT, MA, NJ, NY, WA) is $152,000 - $164,000.

All zones are eligible for equity in the form of stock options.

Additionally, this position is eligible for the following benefits: company sponsored life insurance, disability and AD&D plans. Voluntary benefits such as 401k retirement, medical, dental, vision, FSA, HSA, dependent care and commuter/parking options are also available. Octave offers generous Paid Time Off as well as paid parental leave benefits.

This job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities and activities may change at any time with or without notice.

Application Instructions:

Please complete the following application. Please note that the U.S. Equal Opportunity Employment Information questions below are used for the purposes of EEOC reporting and are optional to complete. Octave is unable to change these questions and we acknowledge that many of the U.S. Equal Opportunity Employment Information questions are not inclusive or affirming of all aspects of cultural identity. Octave is committed to an inclusive workplace environment, and this information will not inform how we approach hiring or employment.

Title: Data Analysis & AI in CMC Intern
Description:
Company Information

Legend Biotech is a global biotechnology company dedicated to treating, and one day curing, life-threatening diseases. Headquartered in Somerset, New Jersey, we are developing advanced cell therapies across a diverse array of technology platforms, including autologous and allogenic chimeric antigen receptor T-cell and natural killer (NK) cell-based immunotherapy.

Legend Biotech entered into a global collaboration agreement with Janssen, one of the pharmaceutical companies of Johnson & Johnson, to jointly develop and commercialize ciltacabtagene autolecuel (cilta-cel) in 2017. Our strategic partnership is designed to combine the strengths and expertise of both companies to advance the promise of an immunotherapy in the treatment of multiple myeloma.

Role Overview

Legend Biotech is seeking a Data Analysis & AI in CMC intern as part of the technical manufacturing and QC development team based in Somerset, NJ for our 2025 Summer Internship Program, which will run from June 9th, 2025, to August 15th, 2025, to extract scientific learnings from datasets. The intern will analyze datasets development studies using conventional and artificial intelligence tools, seeking observations of simple, nonlinear, and multifactorial relationships between variables. The intern will process datasets into appropriate organization and storage, allowing controlled access and manipulation. They will then apply various tools including artificial intelligence and statistical analyses to gather observations from the data and discuss them with technical subject matter experts to interpret observations and create deep scientific knowledge. In addition, the intern will work with technical experts to identify additional applications of analysis tools including artificial intelligence that produce useful outcomes.

Key Responsibilities


In collaboration with information technology experts, organize non-GMP data into databases that allow controlled access and interrogation
Apply various methods including artificial intelligence to identify relationships between variables
Collaborate with technical subject matter experts to interpret results and gain scientific insight from observations
Eliminate trivial and insignificant observations and conclusions
Perform statistical analysis to assess the validity of observations
Suggest experimental designs that can probe and/or demonstrate utility of key observations
Identify creative applications of artificial intelligence for manufacturing and QC datasets
Ensure data security within company policies including responsible use of artificial intelligence



Requirements


Expertise in data analysis
Familiarity with key software tools such as JMP, Minitab, etc
Familiarity with database tools
Proficiency with one or more artificial intelligence tools
Ability to work within company processes to ensure data security
Understanding of biology, immunology, or other related areas
Understanding of statistical significance analyses is a plus



Legend Biotech is a proud equal opportunity/affirmative action employer committed to attracting, retaining, and maximizing the performance of a diverse and inclusive workforce. It is Legend’s policy to ensure equal employment opportunity without discrimination or harassment based on race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, national origin, marital or domestic/civil partnership status, genetic information, citizenship status, uniformed service member or veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Legend Biotech maintains a drug-free workplace.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job Title-Data analyst

Relevant Experience(in yrs) -2+

Technical/Functional Skills


Worked in diverse and challenging environments to drive growth, customer experience, and profitability.
Ability to manage and lead across highly cross-functional teams.
Excellent communication skills with the ability to interact with and understand technical subjects and emerging technologies.
Experience in statistical analysis and adept in tools such as SQL, Python, R, SAS, Excel
Domain expertise in banking risk management and exposure to agent-based risk or compliance operations processes for manual case/alert reviews is ideal for this role
Able to thrive in a fast-paced environment and be responsive and available during times of peak fraud activity.
Strong organization and time management skills and the ability to manage multiple projects and priorities
Understanding of Data Science modeling concepts and exposure to data ETL is a plus


Roles & Responsibilities


Ability to analyze & research large data sets and translate insights into risk and business opportunities/requirements
Design and scale risk processes to cover an increasingly large and complex landscape of compliance risks given our rapidly expanding user base
Design, implement, and monitor experiments to explore new methodologies and estimate key metrics for the compliance operational process’s effectiveness and efficiency
Ability to perform quantitative analysis to improve risk/ sanction operational processes to prevent/mitigate noncompliance issues
Ability to work with product managers, data engineers, and technology teams to enhance/ enrich our data ecosystem/ data marts to quickly scale our compliance operational processes and risk mitigation strategies with an expanding user base and with new product rollouts
Deliver ideas and insights as you collaborate with partner teams, such as engineering, data science & operations to build risk detection systems that drive overall efficiency, customer experience, and agent investigation capabilities
Effectively able to work with product and technology teams to build risk solutions and collaborate with risk operations to operationalize solutions and get feedback.


Salary range$75,000- $95000 a year
