Title: Data Analyst
Description:
What You'll Do:


Minimum 1 year of full-time, analytics-relevant experience
Bachelor’s degree or equivalent practical experience
Ability to communicate in English and Portuguese fluently. Spanish is desirable.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to manipulate data sets to identify patterns and insights, and derive actionable strategies
Skilled in data storytelling and crafting impactful presentations for both technical and non-technical audiences
Conceptual and practical understanding of statistics, A/B testing, and experimental design
Proficiency in SQL, Python, and Tableau for automating analyses and creating compelling visualizations
Strong client and stakeholder management skills, with the ability to engage cross-functional teams
Comfortable with ambiguity; able to select the best solution from various analytics techniques
Team player who thrives in a collaborative, inclusive, and learning-forward environment
Proactive, organized and able to effectively prioritize tasks



Who You Are:


Minimum 1 year full-time, analytics-relevant work experience with SQL
Native-level English fluency and strong presentation and public speaking skills, with the ability to present and defend complex analyses to both technical and non-technical audiences
Bachelor’s degree or higher in a quantitative field (Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering, etc.)
Conceptual and practical understanding of statistics and real-world application of statistical concepts particularly in a testing context
Experience with internet advertising technology (tagging, cookies, trafficking) and digital marketing concepts is preferred



We acknowledge that many candidates may not meet every single role requirement listed above. If your experience looks a little different from our requirements but you believe that you can still bring value to the role, we’d love to see your application!

Who We Are:

Criteo is the global commerce media company that enables marketers and media owners to deliver richer consumer experiences and drive better commerce outcomes through its industry leading Commerce Media Platform.

At Criteo, our culture is as unique as it is diverse. From our offices around the world or from home, our incredible team of 3,600 Criteos collaborates to develop an open and inclusive environment. We seek to ensure that all of our workers are treated equally, and we do not tolerate discrimination based on race, gender identity, gender, sexual orientation, color, national origin, religion, age, disability, political opinion, pregnancy, migrant status, ethnicity, marital or family status, or other protected characteristics at all stages of the employment lifecycle including how we attract and recruit, through promotions, pay decisions, benefits, career progression and development. We aim to ensure employment decisions and actions are based solely on business-related considerations and not on protected characteristics. As outlined in our Code of Business Conduct and Ethics, we strictly forbid any kind of discrimination, harassment, mistreatment or bullying towards colleagues, clients, suppliers, stakeholders, shareholders, or any visitors of Criteo. All of this supports us in our mission to power the world’s marketers with trusted and impactful advertising encouraging discovery, innovation and choice in an open internet.

Why Join Us:

At Criteo, we take pride in being a caring culture and are committed to providing our employees with valuable benefits that support their physical, emotional and financial wellbeing, their interests and the important life events. We aim to create a place where people can grow and learn from each other while having a meaningful impact. We want to set you up for success in your job, and an important part of that includes comprehensive perks & benefits. Benefits may vary depending on the country where you work and the nature of your employment with Criteo. When determining compensation, we carefully consider a wide range of job-related factors, including experience, knowledge, skills, education, and location. These factors can cause your compensation to vary.

For employees based in the US, certain roles at Criteo are eligible for additional rewards, including quarterly or annual bonus and restricted stock units. US-based employees receive access to healthcare, dental, and vision insurance, a 401(k) plan with company match, short-term and long-term disability coverage, life insurance, family forming and wellness benefits, Flexible Work financial support, learning opportunities, and a robust annual leave plan including volunteer time off and summer vacation days.

The US base salary pay range for this position per year is:

$95,000 - $139,500

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Built on meritocracy, our unique company culture rewards self-starters and those who are committed to doing what is best for our customers.




Brown & Brown is Seeking a Data Analyst to join our growing team in Daytona Beach, FL.




The data analyst will engage in all steps of the conversion process acting as an assistant to the Conversion Leader. They have a primary responsibility of ensuring data accuracy throughout the entire process.




How You Will Contribute

Handle all pre-conversion work and preparation.
Map data from previous retail management system through conversion portal
Generate reports as requested and communicate analysis results.
Review multiple versions of data to ensure accuracy.
Monitor the flow of data, checking for accuracy and completeness.
Be engaged on all calls, discern what applies to the conversion and apply that knowledge to the process.
Locate and define new process improvement opportunities.
Other duties as assigned.




Skills & Experience to Be Successful

3+ years of experience in a similar position
Excellent communication skills
Ability to maintain a high level of confidentiality
Experience with one or all of the following products: AMS360, EPIC, BenefitPoint, ZyWave, ImageRight/WorkSmart (preferred)
Strong Excel skills (preferred)




Teammate Benefits & Total Well-Being

We go beyond standard benefits, focusing on the total well-being of our teammates, including:

Health Benefits: Medical/Rx, Dental, Vision, Life Insurance, Disability Insurance
Financial Benefits: ESPP; 401k; Student Loan Assistance; Tuition Reimbursement
Mental Health & Wellness: Free Mental Health & Enhanced Advocacy Services
Beyond Benefits: Paid Time Off, Holidays, Preferred Partner Discounts and more.




Not reflective of all benefits. Enrollment waiting periods or eligibility criteria may apply to certain benefits. Benefit details and offerings may vary for subsidiary entities or in specific geographic locations.




The Power To Be Yourself

As an Equal Opportunity Employer, we are committed to fostering an inclusive environment comprised of people from all backgrounds, with a variety of experiences and perspectives, guided by our Diversity, Inclusion & Belonging (DIB) motto, “The Power to Be Yourself”.

Title: Data Analyst II
Description:
Location: Hershey, PA or Dallas, TX

Role Overview:

As a Data Analyst II at The Hershey Company, you will synthesize complex data using analytics, visualizations, and dashboarding techniques to generate insights and drive action within various products, projects, and programs.

Key Responsibilities:


Collaborate with diverse teams to analyze and utilize advanced analytics for data processing across multiple sources.
Create data visualizations and dashboards to synthesize insights effectively.
Identify opportunities for business improvements by understanding the implications of data.
Produce actionable reports leveraging system reporting tools to drive strategy.
Collaborate with operational teams to manage inputs and outputs of production systems.
Serve as a key contact for production system testing and preparation.
Generate and deliver analytical reports that guide strategic decision-making for business leaders.


Knowledge, Skills & Abilities:


Expertise in data reporting, visualization, and dashboarding tools (e.g., Tableau, SAP GRC, ETL/ELT).
Strong knowledge of data gathering, curation, cleansing, and harmonization techniques.
Proficiency in predictive analytics and familiarity with prescriptive analytics.
Data-related technical expertise, including:
Data curation and harmonization
Database development and regulation
Metadata management
Strong problem-solving and analytical skills.


Experience & Education:


Bachelor’s/Master’s in Analytics, Operations Research, Applied Mathematics, or related fields (Master’s preferred).
Minimum of 3 years of relevant experience.
Proficiency in SQL-based technologies (e.g., PostgreSQL, MySQL).
Familiarity with scripting languages such as Python.

Location: Hershey, PA or Dallas, TX

As a Data Analyst II at The Hershey Company, you will synthesize complex data using analytics, visualizations, and dashboarding techniques to generate insights and drive action within various products, projects, and programs.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Collaborate with diverse teams to analyze and utilize advanced analytics for data processing across multiple sources.

Title: Data Analyst (Mid)
Description:
Job Title: Data Analyst (Mid)

Location: Huntsville

Job Category: Information Technology

Time Type: Full-time

Clearance Requirement: Current TS/SCI Clearance required

Security Suitability: Must pass FBI security suitability

Polygraph Requirement: Must pass an FBI-administered Counterintelligence polygraph if one has not been conducted within the last five years.

Employee Type: W2 or 1099

Citizenship: US Citizen, no Dual Citizenship

Job Summary:

The Data Analyst (Mid) will be a vital member of the Service Operation team, working to enhance data management practices and ensure compliance with Executive Order 14028 and Memorandum 21-31. This role involves supporting the enrollment of enterprise IT assets into the centralized logging repository, developing schemas to standardize logs, and conducting independent validation and verification (IV&V) of consolidated logs. The Data Analyst will also assist in reviewing and approving secured external website access requests (EWARS), managing the Enterprise IT configuration Change Management process, and supporting the administration of accounts for Justice Enterprise File Sharing (JEFS).

Key Responsibilities:


Analyze and interpret data related to enterprise IT asset enrollment in the centralized logging repository
Develop and maintain schemas to standardize the logs being ingested to ensure data integrity and security
Engage with system owners and stakeholders to facilitate the enrollment process and gather necessary data
Conduct independent validation and verification (IV&V) of consolidated logs to ensure compliance with standards and policies
Support the review and approval of secured external website access requests (EWARS) by analyzing relevant data
Collaborate with team members to oversee the Enterprise IT configuration Change Management process, ensuring proper documentation and compliance
Utilize data visualization tools (e.g., Power BI) to create reports and dashboards that present findings and recommendations
Participate in regular team meetings to discuss ongoing projects, provide updates, and receive feedback



Unique Skills/Tasks/Software:


Proficiency in Cybersecurity SIEM tools (e.g., Splunk, Elastic)
Experience with Microsoft Power Platform applications, including Power BI, Power Apps, and Power Automate
Familiarity with Atlassian Software products (JIRA, Confluence, Service Desk) for project tracking and documentation



Preferred Certifications:


PMI Project Management Professional (PMP)
Splunk Core Certified Power User
ITIL v4 Practice Manager (PM)
Microsoft Power BI Data Analyst Associate



Qualifications:


Bachelor’s degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field (or equivalent experience)
Minimum 3 years of experience in data analysis, business analysis, or a related field
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to work with complex datasets
Excellent communication skills for presenting findings and collaborating with stakeholders



Knowledge of cybersecurity principles and practices is a plus.

Title: Jr. Data Analyst
Description:
Job Description

Job Overview:

Our esteemed banking client is seeking a detail-oriented and proactive Junior Analyst to join their growing team. In this role, you will be responsible for leveraging your analytical skills and technical expertise in Power BI, Databricks, and SQL to help the team deliver impactful insights and support data-driven decision-making processes. You will work closely with senior analysts and various departments within the organization to provide actionable insights and improve data visualizations and reporting capabilities.

Key Responsibilities


Collaborate with stakeholders to understand business requirements and translate them into technical solutions.
Develop, maintain, and optimize Power BI dashboards and reports for internal and external use.
Use SQL to extract, manipulate, and analyze data from various sources, ensuring data integrity and accuracy.
Utilize Databricks to process large datasets and perform advanced analytics and data transformation.
Provide ad-hoc reporting and data analysis to meet the needs of key business areas.
Assist in identifying data trends, anomalies, and areas for process improvements.
Support the team in data integration, analysis, and reporting processes to enhance business performance.
Perform data validation and troubleshooting to ensure high-quality reporting.
Assist in the automation and optimization of data workflows to improve efficiency.
Stay up-to-date with the latest tools and technologies in data analysis and visualization.


Qualifications


Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Data Science, Business Analytics, or a related field.
1-2 years of experience in a data analysis or similar role, preferably within a financial services or banking environment.
Proficiency with Power BI for creating interactive and user-friendly data visualizations.
Strong experience with SQL, including writing complex queries and performing data manipulations.
Hands-on experience with Databricks for data processing, analytics, and transformation.
Familiarity with data warehousing concepts and data integration techniques.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to identify patterns and trends.
Excellent communication skills and the ability to present technical data insights to non-technical stakeholders.
Ability to work in a fast-paced, collaborative team environment.


Preferred Skills


Experience with Python or R for data analysis or automation tasks.
Knowledge of financial services and banking industry data.
Experience working with cloud platforms such as Azure or AWS.


**We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate based on race, religion, color, ethnic origin, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.**

Title: Data Analyst, GBM - MPIE
Description:
Responsibilities
About TikTok
TikTok is the leading destination for short-form mobile video. At TikTok, our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. TikTok's global headquarters are in Los Angeles and Singapore, and its offices include New York, London, Dublin, Paris, Berlin, Dubai, Jakarta, Seoul, and Tokyo.

Why Join Us
Creation is the core of TikTok's purpose. Our products are built to help imaginations thrive. This is doubly true of the teams that make our innovations possible. Together, we inspire creativity and enrich life - a mission we aim towards achieving every day. To us, every challenge, no matter how ambiguous, is an opportunity; to learn, to innovate, and to grow as one team. Status quo? Never. Courage? Always. At TikTok, we create together and grow together. That's how we drive impact-for ourselves, our company, and the users we serve. Join us.

About the Team
Global Business Marketing is looking for a Data Analyst to support the Marketing Partnerships & Industry Education (MPIE) team. You will be responsible for leading data and analytics for the TikTok Marketing Partners Program globally. This team develops and executes strategies to advance TikTok's products, value, and vision with the ecosystem of partners. You will be helping build an ecosystem that consists of our 3rd party marketing partners, brands, and other stakeholders. We are looking for a self-starter with excellent analytical skills who is ready to learn and take on new challenges as we continue to build strategic partnerships for TikTok for Business.

Responsibilities
- Work with leadership to establish team-wide KPIs and monitor partner performance
- Triage existing data sources and work with data engineers to enhance or build new data sets
- Conduct deep dive analyses to help the business understand key value drivers and growth opportunities as it relates to our partner ecosystem
- Maintain regular reporting, dashboards, and intelligence assets that are easy to understand, well socialized and intuitive
- Help drive the TikTok Marketing Partners Program's strategy through a data and analytical lens
- Work with cross functional business partners to enable data driven decision making
- Develop creative analyses and experiment with data to extract actionable ideas and insights that can drive the business forward
- Work cross functionally with Sales, Product, Partnerships, Marketing, and other internal teams to drive program success

Qualifications
Qualifications
Minimum Qualifications
- Bachelor's degree in math, statistics, data science, business analytics/management, engineering, computer science or other quantitative majors
- Minimum 4 years relevant experience in data analytics, management consulting, strategy, business development, data science, or finance/accounting at a tech company or fast-growing startup
- Proficiency in SQL, R or Python and knowledge of statistical modeling
- Expertise in BI visualization tools such as Tableau, Looker, Power BI

Preferred Qualifications
- Strong storytelling skills with the ability to translate data analysis into concise and actionable takeaways
- Strong understanding of the digital advertising industry and knowledge of the related partner ecosystem
- Ability to drive ideation, execution, and presentation of analytical projects from start to finish
- Ability to identify and solve complex problems
- Fast learner, highly entrepreneurial with a good sense of judgment and original thinking
- Comfortable working with tight deadlines and changing priorities
- Personable, collaborative and capable of building relationships cross-functionally
- Working professional proficiency in Mandarin language as the role will involve frequent engagement with stakeholders and teammates in this region

TikTok is committed to creating an inclusive space where employees are valued for their skills, experiences, and unique perspectives. Our platform connects people from across the globe and so does our workplace. At TikTok, our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. To achieve that goal, we are committed to celebrating our diverse voices and to creating an environment that reflects the many communities we reach. We are passionate about this and hope you are too.

TikTok is committed to providing reasonable accommodations in our recruitment processes for candidates with disabilities, pregnancy, sincerely held religious beliefs or other reasons protected by applicable laws. If you need assistance or a reasonable accommodation, please reach out to us at https://shorturl.at/cdpT2 .

Job Information
【For Pay Transparency】Compensation Description (Annually)
The base salary range for this position in the selected city is $96000 - $180000 annually.​
Compensation may vary outside of this range depending on a number of factors, including a candidate’s qualifications, skills, competencies and experience, and location. Base pay is one part of the Total Package that is provided to compensate and recognize employees for their work, and this role may be eligible for additional discretionary bonuses/incentives, and restricted stock units.​
Benefits may vary depending on the nature of employment and the country work location. Employees have day one access to medical, dental, and vision insurance, a 401(k) savings plan with company match, paid parental leave, short-term and long-term disability coverage, life insurance, wellbeing benefits, among others. Employees also receive 10 paid holidays per year, 10 paid sick days per year and 17 days of Paid Personal Time (prorated upon hire with increasing accruals by tenure).​
The Company reserves the right to modify or change these benefits programs at any time, with or without notice.​
For Los Angeles County (unincorporated) Candidates:​
Qualified applicants with arrest or conviction records will be considered for employment in accordance with all federal, state, and local laws including the Los Angeles County Fair Chance Ordinance for Employers and the California Fair Chance Act. Our company believes that criminal history may have a direct, adverse and negative relationship on the following job duties, potentially resulting in the withdrawal of the conditional offer of employment:​
1. Interacting and occasionally having unsupervised contact with internal/external clients and/or colleagues;​
2. Appropriately handling and managing confidential information including proprietary and trade secret information and access to information technology systems; and​
3. Exercising sound judgment.​

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
JOB DESCRIPTION







Data Analyst – Supporting Big Data Projects – SQL, Python (must)

Direct Client - Data Analyst – Supporting Big Data Projects – SQL, Python (must) – Data Bricks (Nice Have)

Location: Seattle, WA (Onsite)(Only Local)

Client: Starbugs

VISA-USC AND GC ONLY




Job description

· This job contributes to client's success by guiding business decisions through utilizing data analysis and consulting that results in predicting directional outcomes, understanding complex data relationships, and developing a quantitative return on investment. This position partners on a cross-functional team of innovation leaders supporting strategic initiatives that help shape and define the future of Client.

· Models and acts in accordance with Client's guiding principles.

· Looking at data from a human lens, will not be doing hands on lab testing

Tops 3 Skills Needed

1

SQL Experience

1+ Years

2

Growth Mindset

1+ Years

3

Python

1+ Years

Years of Experience:

· Minimum of 1 years of experience within data analysis field or discipline

Technology requirements:

· Microsoft Office tooling

· Exposure and business-applicable experience in several data ETL (SQL, Python, DataBricks, Java, Ruby, Pig, Teradata, Oracle)

· SQL and Python are priority, data bricks preferred

· Experience with Azure, AWS Databricks preferred

Required background - Skills

· Ability to apply knowledge of multidisciplinary business principles and practices to achieve successful outcomes in cross-functional projects and activities

· Exposure and business-applicable experience in several Modeling & Machine Learning Techniques (regression, tree models, survival analysis, cluster analysis, forecasting, anomaly detection, association rules, etc.)

Degree or certifications required:

· Education: BA/BS with concentration in quantitative discipline - Statistics, Math, Comp Science, Engineering, Econ, Quantitative Social Science, or similar discipline

Daily Responsibilities:

· Extracts data from various databases; performs exploratory data analysis, cleanses, massages, and aggregates data

· Applies basic statistical concepts and descriptive statistics to understand and describe relationships in data

· Builds predictive models and complex descriptive analytics, such as clustering and market basket analysis

· Participates in discussions with business partners to define business questions and to consult

· Creates impactful visual representations of analytic insights and concise summaries of methodology geared to audience needs; presents selected portions to stakeholders

· Provides analytic support (code documentation, data transformations, algorithms, etc.) to implement analytic insights and recommendations into business processes (e.g., automation of process to level up Lab analytics)

· Contributes to analytic project proposals

· Promotes and advocates for value of analytics and data among peers

· Provides knowledge share and mentorship to team in databases, tools, access, data prep techniques

Nice-to-Haves:

· Retail, customer loyalty, and eCommerce experience, preferred

· Data bricks experience

· Larger data sets experience

· Supply chain or UX background

· Innovation and supply chain experience preferred

· Smart sheets

Title: Data Analyst - SAS/SQL
Description:
Sr. Data Analyst - SAS/SQL

Large Banking Client

Duration: 12+ months - potential to extend and ideally want to convert this person FTE.

Charlotte, NC - 4 days onsite 1 remote




Top Requirements:

7+ years as a Data Analyst, Business Data Analyst, Data Scientist, or similar.
Large Banking or Financial Services Industry Experience. Or experience working in a highly regulated environment. (For Ex. Healthcare)
SAS
SQL - strong
Experience working in an ETL Environment
Need to have worked with large datasets
Experience Gathering Requirements and working with Stakeholders




Plusses:

Python Scripting
Informatica




Role Responsibilities:

Gather, analyze, document and maintain all data requirements related to the business applications, interfaces and reporting environments. Apply standards and best practices to ensure the Bank's data is accurate, complete, current, understandable and accessible. Work closely with internal clients, Audit Delivery Teams, business analysts and development project teams to resolve information flow and content issues.




ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES

Following is a summary of the essential functions for this job. Other duties may be performed, both major and minor, which are not mentioned below. Specific activities may change from time to time.

1. Gathers, reviews, analyzes, profiles, validates and maps system data into the data warehouse to meet reporting and analytical business needs.

2. Performs data analysis and troubleshooting on data-related issues reported by production support and other teams.

3. Develops solutions and recommendations for improving data integrity issues. Analyzes data issues and works with development teams for problem resolutions. Identifies problematic areas and conducts research to determine the best course of action to correct the data, identify, analyze and interpret trends and patterns in complex datasets.

4. Determines and analyzes line of business requirements, use system data, and provide input needed by various departments and senior management to produce business reports.

5. Works with extract, transform and load (ETL) developers to test and validate data attributes and with other business analysts to ensure data is integrated consistently, regardless of the source system.

6. Works with business analysts and project teams to provide accurate documentation of data related project and support deliverables. And with source system business analysts to understand system nuances and resolve data issues. Takes ownership of issues through resolution including close coordination between business analysts."







Required Qualifications:

The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

1. Bachelor's degree in information technology, information systems, computer science or business-related field, six years of experience in a role of data analysis, statistical analysis, data transformation, data reconciliation and/or sophisticated data presentation or equivalent education and related training or experience

2. Experience in ETL Development using standard tools

3. Understanding of Enterprise Data Warehouse concepts and prior experience applying that understanding to query data in a Very Large Database (VLDB) environment

4. Familiarity in using a query analysis tool.

5. Knowledge of SQL Queries.

6. Experience with SAS.

7. Experience with Python."




Preferred Qualifications:

1. Banking or financial services experience.

2. Experience working with Informatica.

3. Audit experience"

Duration: 12+ months - potential to extend and ideally want to convert this person FTE.

Charlotte, NC - 4 days onsite 1 remote


Top Requirements:

  • 7+ years as a Data Analyst, Business Data Analyst, Data Scientist, or similar.
  • Large Banking or Financial Services Industry Experience. Or experience working in a highly regulated environment. (For Ex. Healthcare)
  • SAS
  • SQL - strong
  • Experience working in an ETL Environment
  • Need to have worked with large datasets
  • Experience Gathering Requirements and working with Stakeholders


Plusses:

  • Python Scripting
  • Informatica


Role Responsibilities:

Gather, analyze, document and maintain all data requirements related to the business applications, interfaces and reporting environments. Apply standards and best practices to ensure the Bank's data is accurate, complete, current, understandable and accessible. Work closely with internal clients, Audit Delivery Teams, business analysts and development project teams to resolve information flow and content issues.


ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES

Following is a summary of the essential functions for this job. Other duties may be performed, both major and minor, which are not mentioned below. Specific activities may change from time to time.

1. Gathers, reviews, analyzes, profiles, validates and maps system data into the data warehouse to meet reporting and analytical business needs.

2. Performs data analysis and troubleshooting on data-related issues reported by production support and other teams.

3. Develops solutions and recommendations for improving data integrity issues. Analyzes data issues and works with development teams for problem resolutions. Identifies problematic areas and conducts research to determine the best course of action to correct the data, identify, analyze and interpret trends and patterns in complex datasets.

4. Determines and analyzes line of business requirements, use system data, and provide input needed by various departments and senior management to produce business reports.

5. Works with extract, transform and load (ETL) developers to test and validate data attributes and with other business analysts to ensure data is integrated consistently, regardless of the source system.

6. Works with business analysts and project teams to provide accurate documentation of data related project and support deliverables. And with source system business analysts to understand system nuances and resolve data issues. Takes ownership of issues through resolution including close coordination between business analysts."



Required Qualifications:

The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

1. Bachelor's degree in information technology, information systems, computer science or business-related field, six years of experience in a role of data analysis, statistical analysis, data transformation, data reconciliation and/or sophisticated data presentation or equivalent education and related training or experience

2. Experience in ETL Development using standard tools

3. Understanding of Enterprise Data Warehouse concepts and prior experience applying that understanding to query data in a Very Large Database (VLDB) environment

4. Familiarity in using a query analysis tool.

5. Knowledge of SQL Queries.

6. Experience with SAS.

7. Experience with Python."


Preferred Qualifications:

1. Banking or financial services experience.

2. Experience working with Informatica.

3. Audit experience"

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Hi there, we are Popl!




We are looking for someone to be our data/growth analyst.




This is someone who

Is very curious and constantly asking relevant questions to help uncover insights and unlock new ways for us to grow
Has worked with all parts of the data stack, from data engineering to the data analysis




The primary tools you will be using are

Looker
DBT
Snowflake




Required Qualifications:

3+ years of data analysis experience
Looker (DO NOT apply unless you have experience with Looker. Specifically mention “Looker” somewhere in your application)
Immense curiosity about our business and the ability to ask really good questions
SQL/DBT/Snowflake
Strong attention to detail
Good written and verbal communication skills




Nice to Haves:

Proficient with Python
Experience building data pipelines using Python
Familiar with GCP and AWS




You will work very closely with the Executive team and the Product team within this role.




About Popl

Popl is the #1 digital business card platform. Our SaaS products help companies and professionals instantly share contact info with potential clients, capture leads, export contacts to their CRM, and more. Our mission is to completely replace the paper business card with technology that allows our users to get more connections, more leads and more sales. Learn more about us here: https://popl.co/pages/popl-teams

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
We are looking for a motivated and detail-oriented Data Solutions Specialist to support the design, development, and implementation of marketing performance measurement solutions. This role is ideal for a young professional with strong technical and analytical skills who is eager to grow into a senior position over time.




Key Responsibilities:
Assist in the development of advanced analytic models and dashboards to measure marketing performance
Analyze datasets to identify trends and insights that contribute to decision-making
Support database design and ensure the efficient handling of data for analysis
Manage small to medium-sized projects with supervision, gradually taking on more responsibility
Work with internal teams to align project goals and outputs
Present results and deliverables to clients in a clear and professional manner
Maintain data quality and ensure processes are aligned with best practices





Technical Proficiency: Solid knowledge of Python for data analysis
Experience with SQL for database queries and data manipulation
Familiarity with Power BI for creating reports and dashboards
Familiarity with Statistics & Data Science concepts

Ability to communicate clearly and effectively in both written and spoken English.
Bachelor’s degree in a relevant field such as Computer Science, Data Science, or Statistics
1–2 years of experience in a data-focused role is preferred

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Responsibilities

Kforce has a client that is seeking a fully remote Data Analyst to join their team. Summary: They have a heavy focus on PRO discounts, expected outcome and offer changes. This team pulls together data insights (ad hoc SQL queries), look at the trends, look at what the data is telling us, and synthesize the data for leadership/business. The data needs to be structured to run well within tableau. The candidate will also be using GBQ (Big Query), but this can be learned.

Requirements


Fluent with Tableau (or other visualization tools; Will have to do visualizations with tableau in the interview)
Strong communication and attention to detail (analytical background)
Ability to write complex SQL queries from scratch (will be heavy focus on writing queries in the interview)
Ability to pick up Google Big Query
Ability to multitask and work on ad hoc reports
Ability to write complex queries from scratch, not just optimize queries) along with proficiency with Tableau for visualizations


The pay range is the lowest to highest compensation we reasonably in good faith believe we would pay at posting for this role. We may ultimately pay more or less than this range. Employee pay is based on factors like relevant education, qualifications, certifications, experience, skills, seniority, location, performance, union contract and business needs. This range may be modified in the future.

We offer comprehensive benefits including medical/dental/vision insurance, HSA, FSA, 401(k), and life, disability & ADD insurance to eligible employees. Salaried personnel receive paid time off. Hourly employees are not eligible for paid time off unless required by law. Hourly employees on a Service Contract Act project are eligible for paid sick leave.

Note: Pay is not considered compensation until it is earned, vested and determinable. The amount and availability of any compensation remains in Kforce's sole discretion unless and until paid and may be modified in its discretion consistent with the law.

This job is not eligible for bonuses, incentives or commissions.

Kforce is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, protected veteran status, or disability status.

By clicking “Apply Today” you agree to receive calls, AI-generated calls, text messages or emails from Kforce and its affiliates, and service providers. Note that if you choose to communicate with Kforce via text messaging the frequency may vary, and message and data rates may apply. Carriers are not liable for delayed or undelivered messages. You will always have the right to cease communicating via text by using key words such as STOP.

Title: Data Analyst II
Description:
Introduction to Position:

As a Data Analyst II specializing in analytics for the healthcare digital experience, you will play an important role in delivering product and data analytics solutions for leading healthcare organizations. This role requires hands-on experience in product and web analytics with proficiency in tools like Heap, Adobe Customer Journey Analytics (CJA), GA4 integrated with platforms like Freshpaint or Tealium. You will work within a collaborative, cross-functional consulting team, using data-driven insights to support strategic business decisions, improve digital experiences, and drive measurable outcomes for our healthcare clients.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities:


Analytics Implementation and Tracking:
Set up, configure, and maintain tracking on healthcare websites and mobile apps to capture critical data points across user journeys
Work with engineering teams to implement and test tags and scripts using tools like Freshpaint or Tealium, ensuring accurate and HIPAA-compliant data collection
Design and maintain tracking plans, including event naming conventions and data taxonomies
Data Analysis and Reporting:
Analyze web and product analytics data to identify user behavior patterns, conversion trends, and opportunities for optimization in both digital and product experiences
Develop insights, dashboards, and regular reports using platforms like GA4, Heap, and Adobe CJA, ensuring clarity and relevance for healthcare stakeholders
Utilize SQL to query, clean, and transform large datasets, enabling detailed analyses that drive client decision-making
Consulting and Client Communication:
Build strong client relationships by acting as a trusted advisor, capable of translating analytics insights into actionable business strategies
Present findings and recommendations clearly and conversationally, adapting to client needs and anticipating potential questions or concerns
Educate clients on best practices for analytics tracking, data interpretation, and the strategic use of analytics for business growth
Stay updated on industry trends in healthcare analytics, compliance, and data privacy to provide forward-thinking guidance

Preferred Qualifications:


Technical Expertise:
Proficiency in analytics tools such as Heap, GA4, Adobe CJA, and tag management platforms like Freshpaint or Tealium
Data visualization skills using tools such as Looker Studio, Tableau, and PowerBI
Strong SQL skills with a proven ability to write complex queries, optimize database performance, and manipulate datasets
Experience with R and/or Python
Hands-on experience with website and mobile app tracking, including knowledge of tagging, event tracking, and customer journey mapping
Consulting Skills:
Experience in healthcare analytics, including familiarity with HIPAA compliance and the unique challenges of healthcare data
Experience in a consulting environment, working cross-functionally with project managers, developers, and other stakeholders
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to simplify complex concepts and data points for diverse audiences
Demonstrated ability to work consultatively with clients, building trust through effective listening, strategic thinking, and actionable advice
Project management skills to ensure timely and accurate delivery of client analytics projects, with attention to both detail and broader project goals

A successful Analyst II will demonstrate the following qualities:


Curiosity: Our clients often have unpredictable questions, and analysts should be both self-directed in generating their own queries and areas for investigation as well as interested in digging into client questions for ad-hoc reporting and great service
Adaptability: Our toolkit is changing regularly, and our clients often use a wide range of tools across a range of engagements. An ability to work with varied tools, concepts and datasets is key.
Excellent communication skills: We ask analysts to present their findings and results to clients and to internal teams frequently and through a range of methods (oral, written, visual) Communicating the work is a huge part of the consultant’s job!


Minimum Qualifications:


2 years of experience with digital analytics or related analytical fields
Proficient in data analysis, including data cleaning, transformation, and interpretation
Must be an experienced and polished oral and written communicator
Bachelor's Degree or equivalent work experience


Work environment:

Currently, Modea is operating in a flexible working environment that best meets the needs of our team and work responsibilities. Our team has the ability to work either from home or in the office. Our office provides an indoor space with moderate temperatures and noise levels. This position can be located either at the Blacksburg, VA office or Nashville, TN office.

Physical Demands:

Must be able to remain in a stationary position during the duration of the workday. Individual must have the ability to constantly operate a computer. Must have the ability to converse with and exchange information to clients and coworkers both in person and through a computer. Capable of occasionally transporting items of 10 lbs or less to and from the office.

We aspire to be an highly inclusive employer – providing fair and appropriate opportunities to as many people from different backgrounds as possible, being welcoming and meeting their needs as best we can. We are committed to keeping great people representative of a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills, not just because it's the right thing to do, but because we believe it makes Modea stronger.

You must be legally authorized to work in the United States for this position.

Modea participates in the E-Verify program.

Modea is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Modea is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, national origin, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status.

Title: Data Analyst (F/H)
Description:
Nous recherchons un Data Analyst, pour un CDD de 12 mois, passionné par les données et les outils de visualisation pour rejoindre notre équipe. Le candidat idéal aura une connaissance approfondie de Power BI et sera capable de travailler en étroite collaboration avec nos Business Analysts pour les aider à constituer leurs propres jeux de données et tableaux de bord.

Ce poste nécessite une forte capacité d'écoute et une aptitude à partager ses connaissances de manière pédagogique.


Savencia est un groupe alimentaire international, familial et indépendant, imprégné de valeurs d'entreprise fortes et d'une vocation : " Entreprendre pour mieux nourrir l'homme ". Avec plus de 23.000 employés dans 34 pays, Savencia développe des produits innovants de haute qualité qui sont principalement commercialisés dans la distribution et la restauration.

Savencia croit fermement en l'égalité professionnelle entre les femmes et les hommes et à la combinaison de la parentalité avec les ambitions professionnelles de chacun. Cet engagement, inscrit dans sa feuille de route « Vers un socle sociétal », se traduit par des actions concrètes visant à :
- Assurer un environnement de travail sain et améliorer la qualité de vie de nos employés.
- Promouvoir des parcours professionnels équitables et faciliter l'accès aux emplois pour tous.
- Soutenir la parentalité en permettant une meilleure conciliation entre vie professionnelle et vie personnelle.
- Adopter une politique volontariste de non-discrimination et d'égalité des chances à l'embauche.


Le Groupe SAVENCIA est composé de deux entités : SAVENCIA Fromage & Dairy, acteur majeur de la transformation laitière et 5ème fabricant mondial de fromages avec des marques fortes, et SAVENCIA Gourmet, acteur international du Food Service Premium, également présent dans la distribution et les magasins et spécialisé dans la gastronomie sucrée / chocolat, la charcuterie et les marques de produits de la mer.


Pour en savoir plus : https://www.savencia.com/


En tant que futur Data Analyst, vous serez en charge de :


Collaborer avec les Business Analysts pour comprendre leurs besoins en matière de données et de reporting.

Co-créer et co-maintenir des tableaux de bord et des rapports Power BI pour répondre aux besoins des différentes unités métier.

Assurer la qualité et l'intégrité des données utilisées dans les rapports et tableaux de bord.

Former et accompagner les Business Analysts dans l'utilisation de Power BI pour qu'ils puissent devenir autonomes.

Participer à la définition et à la mise en œuvre des meilleures pratiques en matière de gouvernance des données.

Travailler en étroite collaboration avec le Data Product Owner pour aligner les initiatives de données avec les objectifs stratégiques de l'entreprise.



Avantages :

Environnement de travail stimulant et collaboratif.

Opportunités de développement professionnel et de formation continue.

Participation à des projets innovants et stratégiques pour l'entreprise.




Formation : Bac+5 en informatique, statistiques, data science ou domaine connexe.

Expérience : Une première expérience en tant que Data Analyst ou dans un rôle similaire est un plus, mais les candidats débutants avec une forte appétence pour les données et les outils de visualisation sont également encouragés à postuler.

Compétences techniques :

Maîtrise d'outil Business Intelligence tel que PowerBi ou équivalent (création de rapports, tableaux de bord, DAX, Power Query, Data Visualisation).
Connaissance des bases de données relationnelles et des langages SQL.
Compréhension des concepts de gouvernance des données et de qualité des données.

Compétences interpersonnelles :

Excellentes capacités d'écoute et de communication.
Aptitude à expliquer des concepts techniques de manière claire et pédagogique.
Capacité à travailler en équipe et à collaborer avec des profils variés.
Esprit analytique et rigoureux, orienté vers la résolution de problèmes.

Title: Business Data Analyst
HTML:
Are we the best-kept secret in Málaga?

We like to think so. Over the past year, our Málaga hub has grown into a thriving center of excellence, where we combine innovation, collaboration, and opportunity. We are serious about finding the right people and are confident that we have a lot to offer.


The role in a nutshell

Are you passionate about leveraging data to make meaningful business improvements? As a Business Data Analyst within the Coupa Global Reporting & Governance team, you will be instrumental in enabling datadriven decision-making and fostering continuous improvement. Your goal? To turn data insights into actionable strategies that enhance contract compliance, boost supplier performance, and streamline operational efficiency. In this role, you will collaborate closely with diverse stakeholders, acting as a vital link between business needs and technical capabilities. Your responsibilities will include gathering and validating business requirements, translating them into technical specifications, and ensuring user-friendly reporting solutions meet organizational goals. You will uphold best practices in data quality, work towards impactful reporting outcomes, and create a data-driven culture across our global Coupa landscape. With opportunities for growth in a stimulating and innovative environment, you will develop cost-saving initiatives, enhance business processes, and maintain compliance with audit requirements. If you thrive on advancing improvements through data and working in a collaborative global team, this role is your next career move!


More specifically, you will be expected to:

• Analyze trends and patterns in Power BI reports to identify areas for improvement, such as contract compliance and supplier performance;

• Monitor catalogue growth and drive initiatives to increase on-catalogue purchasing and reduce offcatalogue spend;

• Evaluate purchasing trends to enhance contract compliance and support cost-saving strategies;

• Track payment schedules to maximize early payment discounts and optimize cost efficiency;

• Implement initiatives to reduce cycle times for requisitions, invoice processing, and supplier onboarding;

• Advocate for electronic invoicing to improve accuracy and streamline processes;

• Gather, validate, and document business requirements for reporting projects;

• Support data standardization efforts to enhance reporting accuracy and consistency;

• Act as a liaison between business stakeholders and technical teams to ensure reporting solutions align with strategic goals;

• Develop training programs and user guides to empower end users in utilizing reports effectively


Do you have what it takes?

• Skilled at interpreting data and providing actionable business insights;

• Advanced skills in Power BI and Excel; SAP experience is beneficial.

• Solid interpersonal and communication skills to engage with and collaborate efficiently across teams;

• High accuracy and a focus on maintaining data quality in reporting outputs;

• Quick to identify and address operational and technical issues;

• Significant experience in increasing efficiencies and optimizing workflows;

• Experience working across procurement, finance, or accounts payable functions;

• Ability to develop and deliver clear training materials for diverse user groups.


Language : As you will be part of a global team, you are expected to communicate fluently in English (verbal and written). Knowledge of other languages such as French, German, or Spanish is favorable but not mandatory.


Travel: Some occasional travelling will be required.


Location: This role will ideally be based at our Malaga office, but we could consider other suitable locations


Wondering what’s in it for you?

🆙 Be part of a world class organization with a mandate to identify opportunities for improvement and drive performance benefits

🏠 Hybrid Work

💰 Competitive compensation structure

👨‍👩‍👧‍👦 Health Insurance coverage for you and your dependents

🛟 Life Insurance

📈 Growth Opportunities (career progression, tuition assistance, language courses, training and certifications, etc.)

🛬 Relocation assistance


If you are ready to join our diverse team, make a difference and advance your career in a global setting, we want to hear from you.

Join us and help shape the future of data-driven procurement and finance processes! Given the global nature of the role, we ask applicants to submit their resume in English and indicate their working rights status.

Glencore encourages diversity and provides an inclusive workplace.

Accommodations are available upon request for applicants with special needs.

Interviews may start prior to the closing date.

Title: Junior Data Analyst (SQL)
Description:
We offer:




• Become a member of a dynamic team which support Wealth Managements strategic objectives through the use and exploitation of its data and analytical assets

• International/multinational environment: team in Budapest Office works closely with the New York office.

• Collaborative creative environment

• Contingent/Leased assignment working onsite at Morgan Stanley

• Contract via 3rd party agency




You will:




• Partner extensively with other teams and business partners within and outside the department (such as sales, marketing, product owners, data science and data visualization teams) to deliver business solutions and support decision making

• Liaise with Technology partners to understand the data source and suggest enhancements as needed

• Utilize proactive problem-solving and innovative thinking to address challenges

• Build, monitor and review data models and conduct analyses based on specific requirements

• Provide analytics and insight for various business initiatives and projects

• Prepare and deliver presentations to highlight important metrics and showcase achievements

• Create relevant documentation where needed

• Assist in the development of Tableau dashboards and data visualizations for reporting to senior management and business users including Financial Advisors




You have:




• 0-3 years data analytics experience

• Bachelor’s or higher degree in Business Management or Economics or IT or Data Science

• Tech skills: SQL/Python/R

• Strong analytical mindset

• Strong critical thinking and problem-solving skills

• Detail oriented and ability to handle, prioritize multiple tasks simultaneously

• Passion for providing help to navigate through complex decisions for clients

• Excellent stakeholder management and communication skills

• Great presentation skills




You might also have:




• Background in the Financial Services Industry, with an emphasis on wealth management

• Experience working with technology teams closely

• Experience in data modelling and visualization technologies, such as: Dataiku, Python, Tableau, PowerBI, QlikView




Team Profile:




The Analytics & Data (A&D) organization is a key growth area within Morgan Stanley’s Wealth Management Division, playing a critical role in the execution of the wider Wealth Management strategy. The use of analytics and data will be a key driver in accelerating growth across all client segments, enabling data-driven decision making and delivering the best client experience.




About us:




Morgan Stanley is a global financial services firm and a market leader in investment banking, securities, investment management and wealth management services.

At Morgan Stanley Budapest, we are shaping the future of our global business and contributing to our local community. Our team works across numerous areas, including Technology, Mathematical Modelling, Finance, Risk Management, Wealth Management, and Data & Analytics from our state-of-the-art offices near the Danube and our City Gate office in the heart of the City Centre.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
What You'll Do:


Minimum 1 year of full-time, analytics-relevant experience
Bachelor’s degree or equivalent practical experience
Ability to communicate in English and Portuguese fluently. Spanish is desirable.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to manipulate data sets to identify patterns and insights, and derive actionable strategies
Skilled in data storytelling and crafting impactful presentations for both technical and non-technical audiences
Conceptual and practical understanding of statistics, A/B testing, and experimental design
Proficiency in SQL, Python, and Tableau for automating analyses and creating compelling visualizations
Strong client and stakeholder management skills, with the ability to engage cross-functional teams
Comfortable with ambiguity; able to select the best solution from various analytics techniques
Team player who thrives in a collaborative, inclusive, and learning-forward environment
Proactive, organized and able to effectively prioritize tasks



Who You Are:


Minimum 1 year full-time, analytics-relevant work experience with SQL
Native-level English fluency and strong presentation and public speaking skills, with the ability to present and defend complex analyses to both technical and non-technical audiences
Bachelor’s degree or higher in a quantitative field (Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering, etc.)
Conceptual and practical understanding of statistics and real-world application of statistical concepts particularly in a testing context
Experience with internet advertising technology (tagging, cookies, trafficking) and digital marketing concepts is preferred



We acknowledge that many candidates may not meet every single role requirement listed above. If your experience looks a little different from our requirements but you believe that you can still bring value to the role, we’d love to see your application!

Who We Are:

Criteo is the global commerce media company that enables marketers and media owners to deliver richer consumer experiences and drive better commerce outcomes through its industry leading Commerce Media Platform.

At Criteo, our culture is as unique as it is diverse. From our offices around the world or from home, our incredible team of 3,600 Criteos collaborates to develop an open and inclusive environment. We seek to ensure that all of our workers are treated equally, and we do not tolerate discrimination based on race, gender identity, gender, sexual orientation, color, national origin, religion, age, disability, political opinion, pregnancy, migrant status, ethnicity, marital or family status, or other protected characteristics at all stages of the employment lifecycle including how we attract and recruit, through promotions, pay decisions, benefits, career progression and development. We aim to ensure employment decisions and actions are based solely on business-related considerations and not on protected characteristics. As outlined in our Code of Business Conduct and Ethics, we strictly forbid any kind of discrimination, harassment, mistreatment or bullying towards colleagues, clients, suppliers, stakeholders, shareholders, or any visitors of Criteo. All of this supports us in our mission to power the world’s marketers with trusted and impactful advertising encouraging discovery, innovation and choice in an open internet.

Why Join Us:

At Criteo, we take pride in being a caring culture and are committed to providing our employees with valuable benefits that support their physical, emotional and financial wellbeing, their interests and the important life events. We aim to create a place where people can grow and learn from each other while having a meaningful impact. We want to set you up for success in your job, and an important part of that includes comprehensive perks & benefits. Benefits may vary depending on the country where you work and the nature of your employment with Criteo. When determining compensation, we carefully consider a wide range of job-related factors, including experience, knowledge, skills, education, and location. These factors can cause your compensation to vary.

For employees based in the US, certain roles at Criteo are eligible for additional rewards, including quarterly or annual bonus and restricted stock units. US-based employees receive access to healthcare, dental, and vision insurance, a 401(k) plan with company match, short-term and long-term disability coverage, life insurance, family forming and wellness benefits, Flexible Work financial support, learning opportunities, and a robust annual leave plan including volunteer time off and summer vacation days.

The US base salary pay range for this position per year is:

$95,000 - $139,500

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Responsibilities

Kforce has an enterprise client seeking a Data Analyst 3 in North Reading, MA. Current Business Need:


Enhance data analytics capabilities for both OBDA and TASRS product lines
Implement automation solutions to reduce manual processing
Strengthen technical reporting infrastructure
Support product development and optimization


Business Impact


Streamline product-related data analysis
Improve reporting efficiency for product metrics
Enable data-driven product decisions
Automate manual processes to increase productivity
Support data preparation and cleansing for future system implementations
Bridge gaps between current systems and future state solutions
Develop interim solutions that align with long-term system strategy


Requirements


7+ years of progressive experience in business/reporting analytics roles
Mid to Senior level (5-10 years of relevant experience)
Business Analysis/Requirements Gathering (Expert level - 5+ years)
SQL/Reporting Development (Advanced level - 3+ years)
Automation Tools (VBA/Tableau) (Intermediate level - 2+ years)
Flexibility based on candidate qualifications and expertise
Experience with Oracle ERP systems and supply chain metrics
Strong proficiency in SQL, VBA, and Tableau for reporting automation
Proven track record of transforming business requirements into analytical solutions
Strong stakeholder management and communication abilities
Experience in developing and maintaining automated reporting systems
Strong proficiency in SQL database querying and management
Experience with Tableau or similar BI tools
VBA programming capabilities
Analytics and reporting expertise
Process automation experience
Experience with Oracle ERP systems
Understanding of supply chain planning tools
Knowledge of data integration between planning systems


Best vs. Average Candidates: Best candidates will demonstrate:


Strong business acumen and ability to translate requirements
Track record of developing automated reporting solutions
Experience managing multiple stakeholders effectively


Performance Indicators


Number of reports automated
Reduction in manual reporting effort
Accuracy and timeliness of business insights
Stakeholder satisfaction with reporting solutions


Leadership Principle


Bias for Action - Role requires quick understanding of business needs and implementing efficient reporting solutions while maintaining quality and accuracy


Preferred Qualifications


Experience in supply chain or operations analytics
Knowledge of supply chain KPIs and metrics
Prior experience with system transformation projects
Background in process automation initiatives


The pay range is the lowest to highest compensation we reasonably in good faith believe we would pay at posting for this role. We may ultimately pay more or less than this range. Employee pay is based on factors like relevant education, qualifications, certifications, experience, skills, seniority, location, performance, union contract and business needs. This range may be modified in the future.

We offer comprehensive benefits including medical/dental/vision insurance, HSA, FSA, 401(k), and life, disability & ADD insurance to eligible employees. Salaried personnel receive paid time off. Hourly employees are not eligible for paid time off unless required by law. Hourly employees on a Service Contract Act project are eligible for paid sick leave.

Note: Pay is not considered compensation until it is earned, vested and determinable. The amount and availability of any compensation remains in Kforce's sole discretion unless and until paid and may be modified in its discretion consistent with the law.

This job is not eligible for bonuses, incentives or commissions.

Kforce is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, protected veteran status, or disability status.

By clicking “Apply Today” you agree to receive calls, AI-generated calls, text messages or emails from Kforce and its affiliates, and service providers. Note that if you choose to communicate with Kforce via text messaging the frequency may vary, and message and data rates may apply. Carriers are not liable for delayed or undelivered messages. You will always have the right to cease communicating via text by using key words such as STOP.

Title: Data Analyst: 25-03885
Description:
Primary Skills: SQL (Expert), Tableau (Advanced), VBA (Intermediate), Requirement Gathering (Proficient), Supply chain ( Intermediate)

Contract Type: W2

Duration: 12 Months with possible extension

Location: North Reading, MA ()

Pay Range: $50.00 to $54.00 Per Hour

#LP

Job Summary

We are seeking two Data Analytics Specialists to enhance and support our OBDA and TASRS product lines within the Global Robotics Operations team. The ideal candidates will implement automation solutions, strengthen our technical reporting infrastructure, and support product development and optimization. This role offers the opportunity to be a part of a pivotal digital transformation within the industry.

Key Responsibilities


Enhance data analytics capabilities for OBDA and TASRS product lines.
Implement automation solutions to reduce manual processing.
Strengthen technical reporting infrastructure.
Support product development and optimization.
Ensure data integrity and efficacy in reporting and analytics processes.


Must-Have Skills:


5+ years of experience in Business Analysis and Requirements Gathering
Proficiency in SQL, VBA and Tableau Reporting Development
Experience with Oracle ERP systems and supply chain metrics.
